Hey tusher,

Welcome to Google+ - we're glad you're here! Here's a video and some tips  
to help you get started:


https://plus.google.com/_/notifications/emlink?emr=17921042975581350068&emid=CKDfoMzr7sQCFWYNQgod7FkAzw&path=%2F%3Fpop%3Dwv&dt=1428775523347&ub=54


Getting started on Google+
Find people you knowCircles are the heart of Google+ - they control who you  
share with and whose posts you see.  Find people you know, then drag and  
drop them into circles that match your real-world relationships.

https://plus.google.com/_/notifications/emlink?emr=17921042975581350068&emid=CKDfoMzr7sQCFWYNQgod7FkAzw&path=%2Fcircles%2Ffind&dt=1428775523347&ub=54

See what people are sharingNow that you've added people to your circles,  
visit your stream to see what they're saying. When you find something you  
like, add a comment or click +1 to just say "cool!"

https://plus.google.com/_/notifications/emlink?emr=17921042975581350068&emid=CKDfoMzr7sQCFWYNQgod7FkAzw&path=%2Fstream&dt=1428775523347&ub=54

Share somethingTo post for the first time, click "Share what's new" - you  
can include photos, videos, and links. Select the circles or people you  
want to share with, or choose "Public" so that anyone can see what you have  
to say.

https://plus.google.com/_/notifications/emlink?emr=17921042975581350068&emid=CKDfoMzr7sQCFWYNQgod7FkAzw&path=%2Fstream&dt=1428775523347&ub=54


Congrats, you've made it to the end of this epic email. If you're still  
seeking answers, check out the Google+ Help Center.

http://www.google.com/support/+/

Enjoy! - The Google+ Team


Change what email Google+ sends you:  
https://plus.google.com/_/notifications/emlink?emr=17921042975581350068&emid=CKDfoMzr7sQCFWYNQgod7FkAzw&path=%2Fsettings%2Fplus&dt=1428775523347&ub=54

only takes a minute!

Hi Tushar_khan,

We’re expanding the courses we offer on Codecademy and want
to give you a preview. What’s been on your coding list? These are
the courses we’re most excited about sharing in the next two
months.

----------------
Upcoming Courses
----------------

Deploy a Website. Learn to launch your own site, totally from
scratch, using tools working developers do – including Github and
Heroku.

Learn Sass. So you’ve covered CSS. What’s next? Sass is an
intermediate CSS framework that’s required knowledge for anyone
working in Front-End development.

Learn ReactJS. React was developed by Facebook to create the
interfaces for Facebook and Instagram. It’s super powerful, and
also really popular with the startup crowd.

( https://www.codecademy.com/pro?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=roadmap_q2&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=img )

More Pro Content. We’re working overtime to increase the quantity
of projects and quizzes on the site, and improve quality across
the board. Keep an eye out for new and upgraded Codecademy Pro ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=roadmap_q2&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=inline_link ) offerings.

We hope you're as excited as we are! In the meantime, get
back to coding!

Let's code! ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=roadmap_q2&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=cta-btm )
Happy coding!

The Codecademy Team

Codecademy

49 W 27th Street, New York, NY 10001

( https://www.facebook.com/codecademy/timeline?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=email_footer_triggered_default&utm_medium=email )

What You'll Learn:
------------------

helps reduce the repetition and maintainabiity challenges of
traditional CSS. After this course, you'll be able to transition
a CSS codebase to SCSS and style websites much faster.

( https://www.codecademy.com/stories/155?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=user_story_william_ha&utm_medium=email&utm_content=header_img )

William Ha was working as a lawyer when a tough job market made
him consider a career change. William found Codecademy, and
started down the path that led to his becoming an iOS developer.

His story is an inspiration to those looking to make a change in
their lives. Are you ready for something new? Read on to find out
what coding can do for you!

Read William's Story ( https://www.codecademy.com/stories/155?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=user_story_william_ha&utm_medium=email&utm_content=cta_button )

We know that learning to code isn’t easy. From being stuck on a
coding problem you can’t seem to figure out, to not knowing what
to learn next, there are plenty of challenges. That’s why for
learners who want a bit more support, we’ve got Codecademy
Advisors.

When you upgrade to Codecademy Pro ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=benefits_upsell_cc_advisors&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=inline_link ) you get access to our team of advisors. They review your code
and help you get unstuck, as well as give you advice on what to
learn next so you can continue to move forward with your
learning.

Advisors and so much more... Check out Codecademy Pro today!

Learn More ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=benefits_upsell_cc_advisors&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=cta_button )

**********************
Coding Tip Of The Week
**********************

"Take on an ambitious coding project. The challenges
you encounter will push you to learn things you didn't think you
needed to know!"

- Jack R., Codecademy Fullstack Engineer

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-sass?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=code_tip_course_announcement&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=sass_banner )

**********************
New Course: Learn Sass
**********************

We'll teach you how to use Sass - a styling language that helps
reduce the repetition and maintainability challenges of
traditional CSS.

Go To Course ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-sass?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=code_tip_course_announcement&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=sass_button )

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/ibm-watson?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=code_tip_course_announcement&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=watson_banner )

********************************
New Course: Learn The Watson API
********************************

Check out this new course we co-developed with IBM. You will
learn how to build with the Watson Personality Insights API,
enabling you to create your very own cognitive application that
reveals similarities between two Twitter users.

Go To Course ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/ibm-watson?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=code_tip_course_announcement&utm_medium=email_newsletter&utm_content=watson_button )

issues. Its flexible, modular style has made it extremely
popular. At the end of the courses, you’ll know how to build
sophisticated React applications.

You have more friends on Facebook than you think
***********************************************
New on Codecademy: Changes to Progress and More
***********************************************

Hello Tushar_khan,

We’re excited to announce a few updates coming to
Codecademy in the next few days! With this update, we’re
introducing a brand new dashboard and course catalog page.
Furthermore, we’re temporarily changing how we show course
progress. Read on to find out more.

Tracking Progress in the New Dashboard
--------------------------------------

With this release, we’re changing how we show
course progress; now, you’ll get progress on a course once you
complete the entire lesson. This may result in seeing your
reported progress go down, but don’t worry, you haven’t actually
lost progress and you’ll be able to jump right back into the
exercise you left off. This is temporary and will change in the
next few months as we release additional updates.

Focus on What You’re Learning
-----------------------------

Upon signing in, you’ll discover a new dashboard
that contains all the courses you’re taking. Jump right back
where you left off, or browse the courses you’re taking (or
already completed) right there in the dashboard.

Wondering What to Learn Next?
-----------------------------

The new catalog page makes it easier to figure
that out by letting you filter courses by different categories
that range from Web Development to Data Analytics. Want to know
what everyone else is doing? Sort by popularity. Want to get
ahead of the curve? Sort by Most Recent and get the latest skills
today!

A New Look
----------

You’ll also notice the site looks a bit
different! We’re adjusting the interface to provide more detail
and let you see more information, like the contents of course, at
a glance.

Happy coding!

The Codecademy Team

Codecademy

49 W 27th Street, New York, NY 10001

( https://www.facebook.com/codecademy/timeline?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=email_footer&utm_medium=email )
( https://www.twitter.com/codecademy?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=email_footer&utm_medium=email )
( https://www.instagram.com/codecademy?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=email_footer&utm_medium=email )

( http://discuss.codecademy.com?utm_source=customerio&utm_campaign=email_footer&utm_medium=email )

Ashikur, you have more friends on Facebook than you think...
Hi Tushar,

We’re always looking for new ways to improve how you create and work together using Dropbox. That’s why we recently launched several new productivity tools and sharing features[1] . And there’s more to come. To support these changes, we’ve made a few updates to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Here’s a quick summary. 
 - Privacy Shield. We’re excited to be certified under the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework, and have updated our Privacy Policy to reflect this update.
 - Profile visibility. Dropbox may display some of your basic profile information (like your name and profile picture) when you’re collaborating with others.
 - Teammate and team discovery. Dropbox and Dropbox Business team names may be visible to users on the same company or organization domain. Team admins can disable this function[2] . And in the future, this may allow us to help you find others on the same domain.
 - User terms. We’ve clarified terms like how you can cancel your account, and when you qualify for a refund. For users outside the U.S., we’ve also added information about how your country’s laws govern your Dropbox agreement.

 You can read the full Terms of Service[3] and Privacy Policy[4] , which will go into effect on February 10, 2017. For more details, visit our Help Center[5] or send a message to tos-questions@dropbox.com .

[1]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/AAAcge8NzI0WIXTbbEsAd0BxGe20w151_8k/productivity
[2]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/AAAcWhe6UwsnzbZeeTlrFf2aKzQKHhmSf5U/help/9143
[3]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/AADRz5kFTj3mLEaOJULNvAq9F00K_owVxQQ/terms
[4]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/AACbkUJyV8t4WN1YOsQK2tBdyMPY0UwWclI/privacy
[5]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/AADhYhl0v4pOe0TZYAXdZ-WzfKYP9-UVkvQ/help/9063
[6]: mailto: tos-questions@dropbox.com

Get the Most Out of Your Free Account
Hey Everyone !!

What’s up!!

It's that time of the year once again when you get to head bang with the biggest rockstars of the country at the Joy Bangla Concert on March 7.  Like the last two years, we are ready to roar once again with the spirit of Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman’s historic 7th-March speech.

We really hope that you will be present there at the concert just like the last two years, and for that, we are opening a special Priority Window for free ticket registration exclusively for you from 7:00 AM-12:00 PM on Sunday, March 5, 2017. Just go to youngbangla.org http://youngbangla.org/ for free registration to get your ticket to the country’s biggest Rock concert on March 7.

Hey, you forgot to register for the event!!!

Don’t worry! You may also watch the concert live on the Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/YoungBanglaSummit/ and official websites of Young Bangla http://youngbangla.org/ and CRI http://cri.org.bd/. In addition, the concert will also go live on

1.     bdnews24.com http://bdnews24.com/,

2.     Dhaka Tribune,

3.     Bangla Tribune,

4.     Samakal

5.     Ittefaq.

Wait! There's more!!

You can watch the whole event on TV via Channel 9 and Gaan Bangla. Tune into Radio Dhol 94.0 FM for listening to the concert live.

Let's Rock 'N Roll together once again !!

Ciao

Centre for Research and Information (CRI) http://cri.org.bd/

Organizer 

Joy Bangla Concert 2017 https://www.facebook.com/YoungBanglaSummit/

Weekly Tip: How to Show Writing Chops on a Resume

 

 

 

Think of your resume as an opportunity to tell the story of your candidacy. Why are you the right person for the job? How did you develop your skills? Why will you benefit the company?

Weekly Tip: Semicolon Rules and Examples

 

 

 

Semicolons (;) are as basic as a period stacked on top of a comma. Does that mean you can use it like either one? Don&rsquo;t get your hopes up.



 

 

http://click.send.grammarly.com/?qs=7155c3fa096bb36e6731e9d8d0c7a29cd2edf1186a603dc4a7ca1d220afd5f89f41ad52558e5347ffaf41af653da4efaff9d62981b4ab8c13a3e7e5074f03869

Weekly Tip: E.g. vs. I.e.

 

 

 

 I.e. and e.g. are both Latin abbreviations. But why bother with all this Latin? Don&rsquo;t we have enough abbreviations in English?


 

 

http://click.send.grammarly.com/?qs=3c50b7e9b5f23c02f4424a937a33092c4a34e4d847b22e8a7d0ff4d05f82ef4a47ee2f8662f3e08007d63fad37722d8cfb54bbd82a0c77a3a23d54b9bc7be580

Weekly Tip: Create Sharp Angles in Your Writing

 

 

 

Whether you&rsquo;re working on a presentation, a blog post, a rap, or a cover letter, cracking into a new piece of writing is tough. When your subject is broad and multifaceted, where to start rarely feels obvious. You need a way in, a distinct perspective, an angle.

Welcome to the new dropbox.com
When you’re working with others, finding the right file is just the beginning. What about all the other work that happens around those files? Sometimes those conversations or sharing relationships are just as important as the file itself. That’s why the Dropbox website has been redesigned to make collaborating easier than ever.
See the new dropbox.com[1]

Here are a few ways the new dropbox.com can help you be even more productive: 
 - Spend less time coordinating work, more time doing it . With simplified navigation, it’s easier to share files with others, leave real-time feedback, or see what’s changed—without the back-and-forth over email.
 - Get more information at a glance . Browse files visually with a thumbnail view, and see who else is collaborating with you on shared files and folders.
 - Files and activity, in the right place at the right time . Clearer account separation makes it even easier to help you focus on the work at hand, whether you’re at the office or at home. 
 - Find what you need faster . We've made the design of dropbox.com consistent across all pages and simplified common tasks. Now when you select files or folders, a new toolbar shows just the actions you can take with that selection.
 - Bring your files to life with team-first functionality . Designed with collaboration in mind, dropbox.com is not only a space for your files, but for people and conversations, too.


Thanks!
- The Dropbox Team

WEEKLY TIP: How to Write a Good Pitch

 

 

 

You dream of someday writing for renowned newspapers and prestigious magazines. Pitch them. So long as you&rsquo;re polite, the worst they can tell you is &ldquo;not right now.&rdquo; What&rsquo;s to lose?

Newsletter #24
April 19, 2017

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy & the
world of code

---------------------------------------
This Week in Tech: Programming Turns 70
---------------------------------------

April 12th, 1947: ENIAC ( http://bit.ly/2pv9l4J ), the
world's first general-purpose programmable electronic computer,
ran the first code written in the modern paradigm, marking the
birth of computer programming as a profession.

* This first test code ran computations for the hydrogen bomb.
* ENIAC could perform complex coded operations like loops, seen
today in languages like JavaScript ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-javascript?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=history ), Ruby ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/ruby?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=history ) and Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/python?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=history ).
* These first professional programmers were all women, a fact
that took 50 years to be recognized ( http://bit.ly/2pv9eGt ).

Coding ENIAC to solve a single problem would take weeks.
Today, you can build a website ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/make-a-website?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=history ) in a matter of hours!

MAKE HISTORY: CODE SOMETHING ( https://codecademy.com/learn?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=code_something_CTA_main_story )

In Other News

Apple II at 40: Explore Mac History
-----------------------------------

On April 17, 1977, the Apple II ( http://bit.ly/2oiTTYC )
computer was unveiled. 40 years later, your browser can load and
run Classic Mac OS, its successor’s operating system, in seconds.

Relive history: try the Classic Mac OS emulator ( http://bit.ly/2oG3o54 ).

Project of the Week: "Squares Game"
-----------------------------------

Chris used the HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery skills
he learned on Codecademy to create a fun browser-based game!

See it in action ( http://bit.ly/2oimg9s ) and share your
project too ( http://bit.ly/2pbqoft ).

Code Challenge: Test Your Scripting Skills
------------------------------------------

Ready to test your talents with the sorts of questions
developers get in job interviews? Try our latest brain-teaser!
The best submissions are featured each week.

Take the challenge ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/challenge-unique-characters-in-a-string/82151/1?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=this_code_challenge ) and see last week's results ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/challenge-sum-of-prime-factors/81035/1?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-04-19&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=last_code_challenge ).

Thank you for competing in the ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC).  Your problem-solving, programming, and teamwork skills are among the best in the world.  

ACM has provided free student membership to you.  It's an open invitation to help you build your career and to open doors so that you can make a difference.  It's made a difference in my life for over 35 years.
 
Just go to

https://campus2.acm.org/public/qj/freeqj3/fqj_control.cfm?form_type=Student&app=RPC&pd=ICPC&key=4642425A5540595F505C05050177565F515B5E19525D5D

to claim your free ACM student membership.  Your click opens the door to a wealth of career-enhancing resources.  Keep building your prowess.  There are a world of problems that need solving.

As an ACM student member you will have access to online books, videos, courses, and webinars.

For questions about your membership or ACM's products and services, please contact ACM's Member Services Department at 1-212-626-0500 or acmhelp@acm.org.
 
Thank you for participating in the ICPC and best wishes.  You are just a click away from joining me in ACM.
 
Sincerely,
 
Bill Poucher
ICPC Executive Director

Note:  This special offer is available to registered contestants, reserves, student coaches and student volunteers of the 2015 ACM-ICPC Regionals.  The offer is not transferable.

 Hey, Future Grammar Expert! 

 
 
 It seems that you had no logged-in writing activity with Grammarly last week. If you are actively using Grammarly, please just double-check that you are logged in moving forward. We&rsquo;d like to send you a weekly round-up that includes personalized stats that we think you'll like. Write on!
 
 
http://click.send.grammarly.com/?qs=8a6170df6e6959451d1441f4b11c4a3bda9bc080795f2e5cc66dc2c6e354507204cfd4bfa9705f6e4e941cee96117f6969e552b0902c17c04c90c311f2b8564a 
Visit My Editor 
 
 










 


 
 
Weekly Tip: How to End an Email

 

 

 

It&rsquo;s just a word or a short phrase followed by your signature, and yet finding the right tone to close your email often requires a surprising amount of thought and finesse.

ACM has provided free student membership to you.  It's an open invitation to help you build your career and to open doors so that you can make a difference.  It's made a difference in my life for over 35 years.
 
Just go to

https://campus2.acm.org/public/qj/freeqj3/fqj_control.cfm?form_type=Student&app=RPC&pd=ICPC&key=4642425A5540595F505C05050177565F515B5E19525D5D

to claim your free ACM student membership.  Your click opens the door to a wealth of career-enhancing resources.  Keep building your prowess.  There are a world of problems that need solving.

As an ACM student member you will have access to online books, videos, courses, and webinars.

For questions about your membership or ACM's products and services, please contact ACM's Member Services Department at 1-212-626-0500 or acmhelp@acm.org.

Weekly Tip: Willpower Is a Muscle

 

 

 

Your inability to keep your hand out of the cookie jar despite years of New Year&rsquo;s resolutions might actually come down to a weak or underdeveloped willpower muscle rather than a predestined lack of self-control. It turns out that willpower is a skill that can be practiced and strengthened.

Thank you for competing in the ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC).  Your problem-solving, programming, and teamwork skills are among the best in the world.  

ACM has provided free student membership to you.  It's an open invitation to help you build your career and to open doors so that you can make a difference.  It's made a difference in my life for over 35 years.
 
Just go to

https://campus2.acm.org/public/qj/freeqj3/fqj_control.cfm?form_type=Student&app=RPC&pd=ICPC&key=4642425A5540595F505C05050177565F515B5E19525D5D

to claim your free ACM student membership.  Your click opens the door to a wealth of career-enhancing resources.  Keep building your prowess.  There are a world of problems that need solving.

As an ACM student member you will have access to online books, videos, courses, and webinars.

For questions about your membership or ACM's products and services, please contact ACM's Member Services Department at 1-212-626-0500 or acmhelp@acm.org.
 
Thank you for participating in the ICPC and best wishes.  You are just a click away from joining me in ACM.
 
Sincerely,
 
Bill Poucher
ICPC Executive Director

Note:  This special offer is available to registered contestants, reserves, student coaches and student volunteers of the 2016 ACM-ICPC Regionals.  The offer is not transferable.

Make Your Websites "Pop"
************************

You've seen countless webpages before, but only a few
have the extra touches of style and usability that make them
stand out from the crowd. Case in point: this landing page for
Jumpstart, a fictional crowdfunding business.

( https://s3.amazonaws.com/codecademy-content/courses/freelance-1/project-solutions/Live+Sites/F1U8PJumpstart_solution/index.html?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_06_14_two_week_nudge_int&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=image_see_website )

Jumpstart, a project in Codecademy's Build Websites from
Scratch program.

Small details, like these CSS hover and zoom effects, can
turn websites from forgettable to impactful, and portfolios from
promising to professional.

With Codecademy's Build Websites from Scratch ( http://ready.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_06_14_two_week_nudge_int&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_mention ) program, you'll build the Jumpstart page ( https://s3.amazonaws.com/codecademy-content/courses/freelance-1/project-solutions/Live+Sites/F1U8PJumpstart_solution/index.html?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_06_14_two_week_nudge_int&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_see_website ) and fifteen other projects yourself over ten weeks, learning
the tips and tricks real developers use to make good websites
great – skills that most courses won't teach you.

FC Barcelona: "The Barça Legends prepare the match against the Man. United Legends"
Thank you for competing in the ACM International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC).  Your problem-solving, programming, and teamwork skills are among the best in the world.  

ACM has provided free student membership to you.  It's an open invitation to help you build your career and to open doors so that you can make a difference.  It's made a difference in my life for over 35 years.
 
Just go to

https://campus2.acm.org/public/qj/freeqj3/fqj_control.cfm?form_type=Student&app=RPC&pd=ICPC&key=4642425A5540595F505C05050177565F515B5E19525D5D

to claim your free ACM student membership.  Your click opens the door to a wealth of career-enhancing resources.  Keep building your prowess.  There are a world of problems that need solving.

As an ACM student member you will have access to online books, videos, courses, and webinars.

For questions about your membership or ACM's products and services, please contact ACM's Member Services Department at 1-212-626-0500 or acmhelp@acm.org.
 
Thank you for participating in the ICPC and best wishes.  You are just a click away from joining me in ACM.
 
Sincerely,
 
Bill Poucher
ICPC Executive Director

Note:  This special offer is available to registered contestants, reserves, student coaches and student volunteers of the 2016 ACM-ICPC Regionals.  The offer is not transferable.

Unsubscribe:  https://optout.acm.org/unsubscribe.cfm?sc=ICPC-NM&enk=4642425A5540595F505C05050177565F515B5E19525D5D
Reminder for ICPC Participants:  Claim Your ACM Membership

Psst. We Have Something for You (but it's a Secret)
  Regional Programming Camps 2017
Hosted by 
Bangladesh Advanced Computing Society
Hello,

For ACM-ICPC contestants there will be BAPS like regional programming camps in four divisions: Chittagong, Khulna, Rangpur and Dhaka. Around 1000 students will be selected through an online contest (single contest) to participate in all four regionals. 

The online selection contest will be held on July 7, 2017 at 3:00 PM using Toph. To participate in that contest please register here by July 4, 2017. There is no registration fee to participate this selection contest.

After the contest, selected students will participate in one of the four regional. However, outstanding students from Chittagong, Khulna and Rangpur regionals will advance to Dhaka regional for advanced level.

Chittagong Regional will be held on 20 - 22 July at BGC Trust University, Chittagong. Registration fee for Chittagong Regional is 600 Tk. Other regionals' date and venue will be published soon.


For updates please join the event: https://www.facebook.com/
<http://tracking.bacsbd.org/tracking/click?msgid=4N4TXj59I52w2AuP7dj88Q2&target=https%3a%2f%2fwww.facebook.com%2fevents%2f750726961766977%2f&v=PS33ttSinN4KCuimoSLLvg2&lc=881144056028299354>
events/750726961766977/
<http://tracking.bacsbd.org/tracking/click?msgid=4N4TXj59I52w2AuP7dj88Q2&target=https%3a%2f%2fwww.facebook.com%2fevents%2f750726961766977%2f&v=PS33ttSinN4KCuimoSLLvg2&lc=881144056028299354>


For details: http://www.bacsbd.org/events/regional-programming-camps-2017/registration/
<http://tracking.bacsbd.org/tracking/click?msgid=4N4TXj59I52w2AuP7dj88Q2&target=http%3a%2f%2fwww.bacsbd.org%2fevents%2fregional-programming-camps-2017%2fregistration%2f&v=jpt6wG_iCsPRyHN--j3poQ2&lc=881144056028299355>

You can read the FAQ from here.

Please share it with anyone who might be interested.

Thanking you,


Bangladesh Advanced Computing Society
http://bacsbd.org

Visit My Editor 
 
 










 


 
 
Weekly Tip: 6 Ways to Manage Stress at Work

 

 

 

Workplace stress touches most of us at one time or another. In fact, according to the American Institute of Stress, 80 percent of us feel stressed at work. Deadlines loom. Bosses make unrealistic demands. Restructuring means anxiety over job security. Although stressors may be an inherent part of work life, buckling under the pressure doesn&rsquo;t have to be.


 

 

http://click.send.grammarly.com/?qs=0ebba114b2db4a799f4e8b17ea94cf020e5a87f0ffc20500bd08522ee147f3f94d19486ffb67abc4e06e63c979b2cf6ab277565f909d8892caaeb640da59c413

Your Weekly Progress Report: No Activity Found
Build great websites, from scratch. Learn the tips, tricks, and
design hacks that make websites better, faster.

********************************
Team up with the Best of the Web
********************************

Good developers know that, sometimes, shortcuts are okay.
If you want to build a website to show your latest photos, you
don't need to manually upload them every day – you can just
connect to Instagram using an API! APIs let you add advanced
functionality from across the Web, so you can build better
websites faster. Take for example Trackster, a playlist generator
site that students build in our Build Websites from Scratch ( http://ready.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_07_24_int_unengaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_mention ) program.

( https://ready.codecademy.com?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_07_24_int_unengaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=image )

Trackster, a project in Codecademy's Build Websites from
Scratch program.

Trackster doesn't need to host thousands of .MP3 files to
work – it uses the Last.fm API to find them online! Using APIs
to power your projects, you can stand on the shoulders of giants.

With Codecademy's Build Websites from Scratch ( http://ready.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_07_24_int_unengaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_mention_2 ) program, you'll build the Trackster site and fifteen other
projects yourself over ten weeks. You'll learn the tips and
tricks real developers use to make good websites great – skills
that most courses won't teach you.

BUILD GREAT WEBSITES ( http://ready.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_07_24_int_unengaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_cta_build_website )

websites look beautiful on any device, for free! · Try our code
challenge of the week · Join a local study group · Read more in
our newsletter!

Newsletter #31
July 26, 2017

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the
world of code.

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-responsive-design?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=image )

-----------------------------------
New Course: Learn Responsive Design
-----------------------------------

It's never been more important to build for the mobile web –
websites that don't adapt risk getting left behind. Here's why:

* Most Internet surfing, searching, and sharing now takes
place on mobile
* 80% of consumers regularly use their phones to shop online
* Search engines like Google prioritize sites that use responsive
design
* The developing world is skipping desktop adoption in favor of
mobile

That's why we at Codecademy built our newest free course – Learn
Responsive Design ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-responsive-design?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=body_mention ). With this course, anyone can learn the skills they need to
build websites that look great on laptops, desktops, tablets, and
phones.

Unlock the full power of the web: make beautiful websites
that work on any device.

LEARN FOR FREE ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-responsive-design?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=main_CTA )

( https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-responsive-design?utm_source=facebook%26utm_medium=social%26utm_campaign=newsletter_course_share_2017-07-26%26utm_content=share_to_facebook )
( https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?hashtags=LearnCode,CSS&original_referer=https%3A%2F%2Fcodecademy.com%2Fweb%2Ftweet-button&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&related=twitterapi%2Ctwitter&text=New%20free%20course:%20make%20websites%20look%20beautiful%20on%20any%20device!&tw_p=tweetbutton&url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.co%2Fygws5gLoHy&via=codecademy )

In Other News

Code Challenge: Test Your Scripting Skills
------------------------------------------

Every week we help hundreds of coders test their skills
with practice interview questions. This time, try a change-making
question asked at Google!

Take the challenge ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/challenge-change-please/188613/1?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=this_code_challenge ) and see last week's results ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/challenge-product-of-everything-else/176317/1?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=last_code_challenge ).

Local Community of the Week: London
-----------------------------------

Our Codecademy community group in London ( https://www.facebook.com/groups/codecademylondon/ ) has been
running events for over a year, meeting every Saturday at
CitizenM in Shoreditch to learn and build together.

Join a group ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/local-community-groups/79204?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=join_group_CTA ) or start your own ( https://discuss.codecademy.com/t/how-to-create-a-local-codecademy-group/80140?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-07-26&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=start_own_group_CTA ).

***********************
Build Your Own Web Apps
***********************

Session Starts August 7th.
Seats are limited!

APPLY NOW ( http://ready.codecademy.com/build-web-apps/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_08_07_announcement_int_unengaged_v2&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=top_cta )

( http://ready.codecademy.com/build-web-apps/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_08_07_announcement_int_unengaged_v2&utm_term=a&utm_content=img )
Learn advanced skills in JavaScript and React to build
beautiful web apps.

In our newest program, Build Front-End Apps From Scratch,
you'll go from zero to being able to create robust, interactive
web apps using the same libraries and components that power
Airbnb and Netflix.

Over the course of 8 weeks, you will experience:

* Our most in-depth JavaScript training ever – starting
with the basics before covering advanced topics like Modules and
Requests.
* A deep dive into ReactJS, the powerful library made by Facebook
and used by top tech companies like Pinterest and Dropbox.
* Four portfolio projects – all your own work, from scratch.

Take your front-end skills to the next level – three
months from now, you could be building your own web apps.

Your NEW Weekly Progress Report
Build great websites, from scratch. Learn the tips, tricks, and
design hacks that make websites better, faster.

*********************************
Earn Recognition Around the World
*********************************

ENROLL NOW ( http://pro.codecademy.com/build-websites-from-scratch/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_08_21_unengaged_all_engaged_08_07_openers&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=top_cta_build_website )

One of the most important steps towards proving
competency in a field is earning a certification. Up until
recently, new web developers seeking to prove their knowledge
without having an extensive portfolio of work were left with few
options. Codecademy Pro Intensive addresses this problem: it
offers a formal certification.

For example, the Build Websites from Scratch ( http://pro.codecademy.com/build-websites-from-scratch/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_08_21_unengaged_all_engaged_08_07_openers&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_mention ) Intensive offers a certificate to learners who complete 100% of
the curriculum on-time and complete three projects that are
reviewed by our team of experts.

( http://pro.codecademy.com/build-websites-from-scratch/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_08_21_unengaged_all_engaged_08_07_openers&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=image )

The certificate you'll earn when you complete the Build
Websites from Scratch program.

With widely-known publications such as The Next Web ( https://thenextweb.com/dd/2017/08/03/codecademy-adds-new-intensive-options-help-beginners-learn-code-quicker/#.tnw_TPPHh6F9 ), Quartz ( https://qz.com/1045567/codecademy-has-launched-a-new-type-of-coding-bootcamp/ ), and TechCrunch ( https://techcrunch.com/2017/08/03/codecademy-pro/ ) publishing
the launch of Codecademy Pro Intensives, you can be sure that the
certificate you earn from us will be recognized and trusted.
Codecademy is known for high-quality course material and rigorous
testing of applied programming skills.

Give our Build Websites from Scratch ( http://pro.codecademy.com/build-websites-from-scratch/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_08_21_unengaged_all_engaged_08_07_openers&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=body_mention ) Intensive program a try. We can't wait for you to show off your
new coding skills.

A certificate that others will know and trust

 in your browser.

Joy Bangla Youth Award 2017 #
 Spirit of Immortal Joy Bangla still going strong

It’s amazing how a simple two-letter slogan can keep inspiring generations and still go strong even half a century after it was coined. And the overwhelming success of the Joy Bangla Concert 2017, the third of kind
 in three years, is a testimony of that.

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/03/14/joy-bangla-concert-2017-spirit-of-immortal-joy-bangla-still-going-strong/

Joy Bangla Youth Award 2017 #
 Activation phase of registration completed

Young Bangla, one of the biggest platforms for the youth in Bangladesh, has successfully finished the first two phases of the three-part registration episode for the Joy Bangla Youth Award 2017. 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/07/03/jbya-2017-first-two-phases-of-registration-completed/

Joy Bangla Youth Award 2017 #
 Idea Circle organized in Dhaka

Centre for Research and Information (CRI) organized a day-long “Idea Circle” on April 24, 2017 at the Santoor Restaurant in Dhanmondi, Dhaka as part of the preparation for the upcoming Joy Bangla Youth Award 2017, scheduled for October. 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/04/26/joy-bangla-youth-award-2017-idea-circle-organized-in-dhaka/

Kormoshopan Pataton Career Camp #
 The pathway to promising careers

Qualifying for Dhaka University was a dream-come-true for Shampa Rani Roy. But handsome academic transcripts were not enough for jobs in a highly competitive market. As Young Bangla member Shampa enrolled for a three-day career camp at the Sheikh Hasina National Youth Centre in Savar, near Dhaka from January 17-19, 2017. 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/01/24/kormoshopan-pataton-career-camp-the-pathway-to-promising-careers/

LET’S TALK #
 Reducing inequalities cornerstone of social change

What would you do if you were a parliamentarian? There are many things you could do – try to make sure that there are enough doctors in the villages, expand education facilities for specially-abled children, increase the daily wage of tea-garden workers, improve civic facilities, and so on. But, how about a “doing a good work every day” project? 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/03/27/lets-talk-reducing-inequalities-cornerstone-of-social-change/

Sheikh Russel Digital Lab #
 The making of Digital Bangladesh

How often do we see ourselves really good at doing something that we have started learning as a child? Science also supports this. The best time to start learning something is early years because it is during childhood that human brains are in the best condition to keep something stored for life. 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/04/05/srdl-the-making-of-digital-bangladesh/

Joy Bangla Story #
 SUKTARA: Showing way like the evening star

Populated almost entirely by working class people who are either fishermen or farmers or salt-factory laborers, Rupsha has never been well off. Poverty has pushed many children in this area to drop out of school. As a result, literacy has never been a strong point for Rupsha either. That is exactly where begins the story of SUKTARA, the Bangla word for evening star, which, like its name, has been showing way to the destitute. 

Read More>> http://youngbangla.org/2017/04/17/suktara-showing-way-like-the-evening-star/

Joy Bangla Story #
 With Living Legends upholding the spirit of Liberation War

On a sulky afternoon in mid-2006, a freedom fighter was beaten up by a group of derailed young men in Dhaka. Hasan Munawar, a student at the then Jagannath College (now a full-fledged university) in Dhaka at that time, thought something was terribly wrong with the way an entire generation had grown up.

Hello,

Hope you're doing fantastic! I noticed that you just signed up at HackerRank, and I wanted to personally thank you. I'm the founder/CEO and my goal is to offer the best experience possible to users.

HackerRank is here to create a community of developers who love to solve programming challenges across computer science domains and in over 30 programming languages. We have challenges spanning Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and many more! You'll solve a structured set of challenges that take you through the basics to real-world in every domain in a way that is fun but also helps you become the best developer you can be. Solve at your own pace or compete in one of our [contests](http://email.postmaster.hackerrankmail.com/c/eJxNj8tuhDAMRb8GdoPyIqaLLObR-Q1kJe6AIIASI36_oVVHlbywjo6vdYP7sBZVPTolJIhOGWFbI6Ax1oJu1P0Gn-3N6IeEqzFdZcS2Zo6YmVIzoJ8oJVymiOPc-DXWg5MdaC1DAKk1-BaCtB61CBiEaQlDPbuBecuVvlbqWeY4jn9JZ0qBfl2YMhfruXPsI4Vxj5V-0PmpUvaEHuOG42sp-E-_vNmvktc9eSrC17ovgdLl575Ojvc8UJoGXFrQpdXr3YDdufZMcZuRqbdgvwGNGGAb).

To complement that, HackerRank partners with top tech companies to offer [exclusive jobs](http://email.postmaster.hackerrankmail.com/c/eJxNT0uOgzAMPU3YFYUkOGGRRTttr4E8IRQGAigfcf0mM1I1khd-Hz_bg-4AkFWzZrSRVDFBoRVU1gJA8pp93eSjvQl-b-RVCEUEPfYQHYZofT2hWaz3uC0O57U2u6smzfkAcuxUwwGEGDumJCo0QEWXcUurVU8xHoHwK2HPXOd5_ksqKZn82b-z45mi650d5uQIv9uyhTAopEF34PzaMl2slw_-k8OevLFZHPe0DdZffmcrr2MKk_XLhFsref7m9bk86tL20bpjxWh7kPAGp2RbmQ) to our developer community. Solve a company's code challenge from our Jobs section and you're guaranteed a response from that company within five business days.

Thanks again for signing up, and I'd love to hear any feedback you have on HackerRank (good or bad). Have an awesome day and happy coding!

Cheers,  
Vivek


Thank you for signing up - Founder, HackerRank

  | Hi tusher,  
    
Ready to become a better coder? Practicing for a programming job interview?  
    
Join thousands of other HackerRank members who are learning to code or brushing up on fundamentals. Each day, you’ll get a new code challenge and a corresponding video tutorial to help you learn.  
    
You’ll be surprised at how much you can learn by coding for 30 days straight. Learn more details [here](http://email.postmaster.hackerrankmail.com/c/eJxtkM1uhSAQhZ9Gdxp-BHTh4t6Y-xqEIl6MAoafmr59oWlaFyazmDlz8p3JzONAqUD1OiIAGegRAxR1ELSMDYy2E4DPaXpARnsIn4RUHThciEaEqHyrhdyU98JuRqx7K52p9Thjghbc93ggH6rrFQZKYUkJFEOHEVD1PuoYj1DhR4Veuc7zvJAKJYuzy0gbchdTdH4Ve-kxaGbxFRq3NNLNqsIvzX2FJ1XyK0Q1_8wTBry4uFt4cXGrzrxL0XApzCHWt70xSWfjapNL4ddr1Lwmc4EXMbjkZc6dDu-M4z-r2o8xBa38poUlDOcfvf_-Eceba27U_3h-QX8DlrGLdw). Topics include if-then-else statements, recursion, data structures, object-oriented programming, running time, and testing.  
    
What are you waiting for? |

New friend suggestions for you include Sabit Khan, Abdullah Al Noman and 8 others.
BANGLADESH INSIGHT | August 24, 2017

http://www.albd.org/

August 24, 2017

https://goo.gl/vH1nPr

ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING INDEX; Bangladesh goes up 28 notches https://goo.gl/vH1nPr

Bangladesh went up 28 notches in the anti-money laundering and counter terrorist financing (AML/CTF) index of the Basel Institute on Governance -- a development that will come as a pat on the back for the government. In South Asia, the country stood second on the league table while stood out as one of the 10 countries that made the most progress. The report said Bangladesh saw a big jump in its ranking due to the results of the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) Mutual Evaluation Report in October 2016. On the other hand, according to the central bank the country implemented all 40 of the Asia/Pacific Group on Money Laundering's recommendations and managed full compliance in six categories, near full compliance in 22 and partial compliance in 12.

Bangladesh's per capita income can hit US$50,000: World Bank https://goo.gl/am48zB

A World Bank (WB) official has pinned hopes that Bangladesh has the potential to take its per capita income at a staggering US$50,000, through building skills and exploring the opportunities in technical sector. According to Dr Mohammad Mokhlesur Rahman, Senior Operations Officer of the World Bank if the country can tap into its potential, it can emerge out as a growing power in south Asia. Owing to a raft of prudent economic policies undertaken by Honorable Prime Minister (HPM) Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh has been graduated to the lower middle income status while the country maintained a steady growth rate at above 6% over a space of last six years. 

HPM Sheikh Hasina assures flood victims of adequate support for 3 months https://goo.gl/jXsX79

During a recent visit to flood affected areas in the countries, HPM Sheikh Hasina announced that the government would provide food assistance to the flood-affected families for the next three months until the next crops are harvested. The Premier also said the government would do everything possible to ensure their food, healthcare and other necessities. She added that it was her responsibility to ensure houses for every citizen, and the government of Awami League was working to provide homeless people with houses on khas land. At her directives, the government has allocated 21,900 metric ton (MT) rice, cash assistances https://goo.gl/5wv1L3 and 55,000 packets of dry food for the flood hit people in 32 districts since August 9. 

Bangladesh observes August 21 grenade attack day https://goo.gl/CrJJV8

The 13th anniversary of the gruesome August 21 grenade attack on an Awami League rally has been observed with various programmes in a somber mood last week. On this day in 2004, the gruesome grenade attack was carried out on an anti-terrorism rally arranged by Awami League at Banbabandhu Avenue in the city at the directives of the BNP- Jamaat https://goo.gl/xQGAjq alliance government. The main target of the heinous attack was current Prime Minister and then opposition leader Sheikh Hasina. At least 24 leaders and activists were killed and 300 others injured in the grenade attack https://goo.gl/vT2y8c. Moreover, evidence from the grenade attack scene was intentionally destroyed while a police investigation into the incident was diverted along other avenues. 

Japan's development assistance to Bangladesh will continue: envoy tells HPM https://goo.gl/zuhUxd

Japan will continue its development assistance to Bangladesh in various sectors as it is already providing 600 billion yen for different mega projects. Outgoing Japanese Ambassador in Bangladesh Masato Watanabe came up with the remarks when he made a farewell call on HPM Sheikh Hasina at her office this week. The Ambassador focused more on economic ties between the two countries and laid emphasis on advancing that further. 

https://goo.gl/4JkbLy

INFRASTRCTURE AND MEGA PROJECT 

https://goo.gl/Lh36Ft

Large scale railway projects on cards https://goo.gl/Lh36Ft

The railways ministry has initiated a move to convert the Parbatipur-Kownia railway track into a dual gauge one with India's second Line of Credit (LoC) to boost connectivity between Bangladesh and India. According to the seventh Five Year Plan, the government is planning to set up a 1,110-km dual gauge railway double track as both Bangladesh and India have put emphasis on boosting connectivity through railway network to facilitate movement of passengers and transportation of goods. On the other hand, the Asian Development Bank (ADB) https://goo.gl/KesuXq will invest a big sum of money to give a new lease of life to this sector through adding more locomotives, wagons and other equipment. 

$394 million revolving fund soon to finance LNG import https://goo.gl/FnV8gN

The government has moved to form a revolving fund worth over $394 million to meet initial import cost of liquefied natural gas (LNG) meant for catering a growing energy demand. At present, a large amount has been accumulated in the Energy Security Fund from higher-rated fuel sales to the public. Bangladesh plans to start LNG import by April 2018 to bring about a better energy mix against the backdrop of depleting domestic gas reserves. The country's first LNG-import terminal, with a capacity of 3.75 million tonnes per year, is being developed by US-based Excelerate Energy and is expected to be commissioned in April 2018. 

GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT

https://goo.gl/obSpQd

Bangladesh Bank plans fresh agri loans for flood-hit farmers https://goo.gl/obSpQd

Bangladesh Bank considers providing fresh agricultural loans to flood-hit farmers so that they can recover losses from damaged crops. The central bank is now working to identify the affected areas across the country where fresh loans and other facilities will be provided. The commercial banks were asked through a circular to provide fresh loans to the flood-hit farmers and accelerate loan disbursement under refinance schemes of Bangladesh Bank at a reduced interest rate. In 2014, the central bank provided agricultural loan facilities to farmers in 21 flood-affected districts. 

Fish output surpasses 4.0m tonnes in FY '17 https://goo.gl/kKM4Pd

Bangladesh's fish production recorded a 61% rise in last ten years and crossed the 4.0 million tonnes mark in the last financial year. Officials attributed the rise in production to quick introduction of modern technology in local fish farming. The provisional data of the Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS) showed that the country's inland and marine fish production together rose to 4.01 million tonnes in FY 2016-17 from 2.49 million tonnes ten years ago in FY2006-07. On the other hand, according to the United Nations' Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO), Bangladesh is the fourth largest inland fish producer in the world after China, India and Myanmar.

Govt. strengthens social safety net programme to cut poverty https://goo.gl/oLn1ax

The government has strengthened the social safety net programme with an allocation over $6 billion which is 13% of the total budget. Following the inclusion of new beneficiaries, the total number of people under major social safety net programmes would stand at 8.6 million. Under the scheme, some 3.15 million people now receive $7 each a month. Around 1.1 million women currently receive Tk 500 each a month under the “Allowances for the Widow, Deserted and Destitute Women” while the government will increase the number of beneficiaries under the “Maternity Allowance Programme for the Poor” by 1,00,000 while the amount has been raised by $4. Some 75,000 more people will be entitled to get “Allowances for the Financially Insolvent Disabled” in the next fiscal.

TRADE AND INVESTMENT 

https://goo.gl/aHfD33

Bangladesh heading towards $60bn export by 2021 https://goo.gl/aHfD33

Works are progressing fast towards bagging US$ 60 billion earning from export by 2021. Under the able leadership of HPM Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh is working to implement BBIN (Bangladesh, Bhutan, India and Nepal) and BCIN (Bangladesh, China, India and Myanmar) connectivity. On the other front, Bangladesh has formulated a trade policy securing local industry, resulting in the country's self-reliance in cement, iron, paper, CI sheet and few other products.

Processed Food: Govt to ensure safety by 2021 https://goo.gl/bXa2YR

The government aims to make processed food producers comply with set standards so that safe food could be ensured by 2021. Bangladesh Food Safety Authority (BFSA) said it had taken up an initiative to get 2.5 million food business operators registered. This would allow them to be properly monitored and supervised. The BFSA is also taking strides to ensure risk-based food inspections to guarantee food safety, from farm to fork, said its officials at the first ever Bangladesh Food Safety Conference held this week. 

Govt changes incentive structure for exports https://goo.gl/Hge5Do

The government has brought some major changes to the incentive structure for exports in order to achieve a higher overseas sales target set for the current fiscal year. Bangladesh Bank released an incentive structure for 2017-18, granting stimulus to five sectors for the first time and increasing existing rates for four. With the new additions, 27 sectors will receive 2 to 20% incentive on the price of the goods. The number of sectors entitled for the benefit was 22 in the last fiscal year. The incentive for export of crust and finished leather has been doubled to 10 % from existing 5% if the tanneries at Hazaribagh relocate to Savar.

Hi Tushar_khan,

We want to share with you an important fact from a highly-cited market research report ( http://burning-glass.com/wp-content/uploads/Beyond_Point_Click_final.pdf )released by Burning Glass last summer: computer coding skills lead to higher paying jobs. Much higher paying jobs. Jobs requiring coding skills pay $22,000 more per year than jobs that don't. But that's not all.

Coding jobs are the leading source of job growth in the economy, growing 50% faster than the market overall. Our purpose at Codecademy is to help you learn the skills needed to succeed in these new coding jobs. That's why we recently released our most immersive offerings yet: Codecademy Pro Intensives.

Hi there,

For beginner and experienced programmers alike, the programming world is filled with intimidating acronyms that can be confusing to learn. Our newest Pro Intensive, Build Web APIs from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-web-apis-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=api_10_03_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ), is our first program that decodes the nuts and bolts of back-end web services — everything that happens behind the scenes of the browser, on servers and databases.

By the end of this 8-week program, you'll be able to confidently answer questions such as "What is an API?", in
addition to learning about the "back-end", "REST", "CRUD", and so much more. But that's not all: We've arranged for a professional programmer to review and provide feedback on three real-life projects using ExpressJS. We believe this will give you an authentic taste of what it's like to build your own APIs that store and service information.

Build Web APIs from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-web-apis-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=api_10_03_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) takes you from no back-end coding experience to building functional and reliable APIs in just 8 weeks. Complete your
enrollment today to secure your seat in our first cohort, which begins on October 3rd:

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-web-apis-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=api_10_03_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=enroll_now_link )

We can't wait to see what you build next.

Codecademy

Hi there,

When we talked with recent graduates of our immersive Pro Intensive programs ( http://pro.codecademy.com/#lp-pom-text-2466 ), we learned that the community — the group of Codecademy learners who complete a Pro Intensive together — was one of the main differentiators that helped them get to the finish line. Working together, they were able to complete difficult exercises and understand challenging topics better and faster than they could do alone.

For example, learners who enroll in Build Websites from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-websites-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_m_minus_10_17_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) receive an invite to join a private Slack channel at the start of the program so that they can converse with their peers. Our graduates report that this channel, which a Codecademy Pro Advisor moderates, is one of their favorite resources for receiving help and support throughout the 10-week program.

While the Build Websites from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-websites-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_m_minus_10_17_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) program formally concludes after just 10 weeks, the informal support network and the friendships created do not. Your community of Codecademy Pro Intensive learners will be available to you for years to come, no extra cost.

A close, collaborative community isn't just better for learning, it's how professional coders get the job done. So, are you ready to get coding, together? Start by learning how to Build Websites from
Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-websites-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_m_minus_10_17_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) — our program that we designed to quickly take you from no coding experience to building beautiful websites.

Complete your enrollment today to secure your seat in our next cohort that begins on October 17th:

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-websites-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bws_m_minus_10_17_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=enroll_now_link )

Codecademy

Welcome to HackerEarth. You are now a member of the world's fastest growing developer hub.




                Our aim is to give developers an ecosystem where they can learn, practice, and work on their programming skills. Here are some things that you can do to get started:
            


Practice programming problems

Compete with the best developers and challenge yourself

Build products by participating in hackathons



              	How has HackerEarth helped you become a better programmer? Reply to this email to share your experience with us.

FC Barcelona: "Recovery session with Copa del Rey on the horizon"
We've rewritten our free CSS and jQuery content, giving you the latest tools to make beautiful websites faster · Coding jobs without CS degrees · Hacktoberfest · Read more in our newsletter!

Newsletter #38October 23, 2017

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

-----------------------
Free Web Design Courses
-----------------------

Effective websites need to do more than just get the job done – they need to be well designed. We've been hard at work updating our curriculum so you can learn the best, latest skills – for free – with us.

With our new CSS course, you'll use tools like CSS Grids, which make managing the overall layout of pages simpler. With our new jQuery course, you'll learn easy ways to add dynamic behavior to your web pages. Combined, you'll be able to build better websites, easier.

Many of the world's top web pages are built with jQuery – sites like Amazon.com, The New York Times, and Stack Overflow – and almost every single site on the web uses CSS!

Make beautiful websites, faster – take our updated jQuery ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-jquery?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-10-23&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=jquery_mention ) and CSS ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-css?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-10-23&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=css_mention ) courses.

LEARN WEB DESIGN ( https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/web-development?utm_source=customerio&utm_medium=Fortnightly-2017-10-23&utm_campaign=newsletter_a&utm_content=learn_web_design )

In Other News

Self-Taught Programmers Getting Top Jobs
----------------------------------------

Codecademy alum & Software Engineer at Pinterest, Madelyn Tavarez, is just one example of how coders without CS degrees land jobs at top companies.

Read Fast Company's report on these hiring trends ( https://www.fastcompany.com/40482650/these-top-tech-companies-are-hiring-first-training-later ).

Last Call for Hacktoberfest
---------------------------

Practice your coding skills, contribute to the greater good, impress employers and win a free t-shirt. We're joining Hacktoberfest and you should too!

Find out more about this year's Hacktoberfest ( https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/?utm_source=codecademy ).

Coding: Most Important Second Language?
---------------------------------------

This year's Goldman Sachs’ interns, some of the top emerging talent in the US, say that Python is a more important language to learn than Mandarin.

Find out more ( https://work.qz.com/1104424/the-next-generation-of-wall-street-titans-thinks-learning-python-is-more-important-than-mandarin/ ).

New friend suggestions for you include Atanu Kumar Biswas, Raisul Islam Sunny and 8 others.
BANGLADESH INSIGHT | August 24, 2017

http://www.albd.org/

October 26, 2017

https://goo.gl/arXb5Y

HPM Sheikh Hasina Reiterates 5-Point Proposal to Resolve Rohingya Crisis https://goo.gl/arXb5Y

Honourable Prime Minister (HPM) Sheikh Hasina said the Rohingya crisis could be resolved in line with the five-point proposal she had placed in last month’s UN General Assembly session in New York. The five-point proposal that the prime minister laid out includes an end to the violence in Myanmar, immediately sending UN mandated Fact-Finding Mission to Myanmar, creation of "safe zones" inside Myanmar under UN supervision, sustainable https://goo.gl/4NEhmj return of all forcibly displaced Rohingyas to their homes in Myanmar and implementation of recommendations of Kofi Annan Commission Report. The Premier also reiterated that Bangladesh has been carrying the burden https://goo.gl/Grk5RQ of around 4,00,000 Rohingyas for decades as they were victims of ethnic persecution in their homeland Myanmar.

US senators laud Bangladesh Premier for able leadership on Rohingya issue https://goo.gl/GfyFoL

Nine US senators have sent a letter thanking Honourable Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina for her strong leadership and compassion on the Rohingya crisis. More than 600,000 refugees fleeing the military crackdown in Myanmar took shelter in Bangladesh. Terming HPM as a beacon of hope, the letter praised Bangladesh’s decision to keep the borders open and provide assistance to the large number of refugees fleeing the military crackdown in Myanmar. The senators said they were also aware of the strain the refugees put on Bangladesh’s limited resources, especially considering the refugee population that had been staying in the country prior to the recent influx. 

Every year, under-5 mortality comes down by 5.5% https://goo.gl/VmDofV

According to a report, released recently by United Nations agencies, under-five mortality rate in Bangladesh has dropped by an annual 5.5% over the last 16 years till 2016. This report stands out as a shining testament to the commitment, put in place, by the government, to ensure a healthy life for its citizens, resulting in a rise in the average life expectancy in the country. In this endeavor, introduction of community clinics and an array of health services at doorsteps played a key role too. 

FDI hit record $2.45 billion last fiscal year https://goo.gl/svTeHT

A recent report, released by Bangladesh Bank, shows foreign direct investment hit an all-time high of $2.45 billion in fiscal 2016-17 on the back of a surge in equity investment by mobile phone operators. The inflows are an increase of 22.54% from a year earlier while the telecom sector saw the highest inflows of $594 million, followed by textile and garment at $360.35 million and power at $334.26 million. Last fiscal year, $701 million flew in from the Singapore, $314 million from the UK, $208 million from the US, $187 million from Norway while reinvestment of earnings by existing foreign companies also edged up 8.70% last fiscal year to $1.25 billion. 

UNESCO awards Bangladeshi microbiologist https://goo.gl/awswJC

Professor Dr Samir Saha, an eminent microbiologist of Bangladesh has been announced for UNESCO Carlos J. Finlay Prize in Microbiology in 2017 along with others. The award was created by UNESCO in 1977, on the initiative of the Government of Cuba, and is given to scientists with research and work that signify an important contribution to the field of microbiology. The prize will be granted on November 6, 2017 within the framework of the 39th session of the General Conference of UNESCO, which brings together its 195 member States from October 30 to November 14. 

https://goo.gl/rRBPJo

Growth and Development

https://goo.gl/rS7nxc

ADB approves $1.2 billion to improve road communication https://goo.gl/rS7nxc

Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved $1.2 billion in finance for the second phase upgrade of the Dhaka-Northwest international trade corridor in Bangladesh. The ADB funding will support the corridor by improving the 190-km section from Elenga through Hatikurul to Rangpur while road operation and management in the Roads and Highway Department will also be strengthened. Besides, the upgradation project will help increase road capacity on 70 kilometers of the Joydeypur-Elenga section of the road. It will also improve operational efficiency of two of the land ports - Burimari and Benapole - that provide gateways to Bhutan and India, respectively. 

Bangladesh outperformed India, Pakistan in global hunger index https://goo.gl/nfBXwr

A report, released by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI), has put Bangladesh ahead of countries like India and Pakistan in the fight to reducing the menace of hunger. While Bangladesh stood at 90th position, among other South Asian countries India ranked 100, Pakistan 106 and Afghanistan 107. In last eight years, under the prudent leadership of HPM Sheikh Hasina, poverty has come down to below 22% from an alarming 44% and with it the fight against hunger has seen a significant gain too. 

TRADE AND INVESTMENT

https://goo.gl/Hpexqu

Services sector exports go up 23.67% https://goo.gl/Hpexqu

Services sector exports hit $619.97 million in the first two months of the fiscal year, overshooting its target for the period by 6.28%. The amount is an increase of 23.67% from a year earlier, according to data from the Export Promotion Bureau, released this week. The EPB began counting the export earnings from services sector separately from last fiscal year as contributions of some important services sectors like transportation, manufacturing, air and sea transports went unnoticed. 

Dhaka-Kathmandu agree to bolster trade ties https://goo.gl/PWQWNA

Bangladesh and Nepal have agreed to examine existing tariffs and remove non-tariff barriers and para-tariff measures aiming to take the bilateral trade ties to a newer height. The two countries also agreed to exchange trade delegations, organise trade fairs, single country trade fair and sign the pending memorandum of understandings on the Bilateral Trade Promotion and Protection Agreement and the Bilateral Agreement for the Avoidance of Double Taxation soon. The decisions were taken during the second Foreign Office Consultation between Bangladesh and Nepal last week. 

IAF extends support for sustainable RMG sector in Bangladesh https://goo.gl/7fX4rA

The International Apparel Federation (IAF) has assured Bangladesh of extending their support for sustainable RMG sector. IAF President Han Bekke came up with the assurance during his recent meeting with Bangladesh Ambassador to the Netherlands Sheikh Mohammed Belal at the Embassy of Bangladesh in The Hague. The IAF President elaborated their plans for sustainable RMG sector in Bangladesh through cross-over of cooperation among the Dutch government, Bangladesh government, specialised educational institutes in fashion, design and branding of both Bangladesh and the Netherlands.

INTERNATIONAL AND REGIONAL COOPERATION 

https://goo.gl/9ehHcA

Sushma Swaraj visits Bangladesh to bolster ties https://goo.gl/9ehHcA

India's External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj this week said Bangladesh comes first among all of India's neighbours as part of a neighbourhood policy her government adopted. The countries' bilateral ties are becoming stronger, she added. The envoy said these while inaugurating the new Chancery Complex of the High Commission of India at Baridhara and 15 India-funded development projects worth $800 million in Bangladesh. She arrived in Dhaka on Sunday and participated in the Fourth Joint Consultative Commission meeting with her Bangladesh counterpart AH Mahmood Ali.

Queen Rania calls for greater int'l response to end Rohingya crisis https://goo.gl/y7PqzD

During her recent visit to Bangladesh, Queen Rania Al Abdullah of Jordan called on the international community to respond effectively, quickly, and generously to bring an end to the sufferings of Myanmar's Rohingya minority. Meanwhile, European Commission pledged an additional amount of Euro 30 million (US$35.29m) https://goo.gl/L6FA3J while the head of the UN agency that coordinates humanitarian aid says they have pledged roughly $340 million https://goo.gl/aMeqyH to help more than 6,00,000 Rohingyas who have fled Myanmar into Bangladesh since August.

DIGITAL BANGLADESH 

https://goo.gl/pGewMp

PayPal Xoom launched in Bangladesh https://goo.gl/pGewMp

This week, the Prime Minister's ICT Adviser Sajeeb Wazed inaugurated the global online payment system PayPal, expressing hope that the time to bring in money from abroad through hundi and corruption will come to an end. Using this service, Bangladeshi expatriates will be able to send money home within a few hours while those involved in freelancing and outsourcing will also enjoy the facility. PayPal account holders from abroad can now send up to $10,000 to Bangladesh at a time using PayPal wallet. A transaction of up to $1,000 will cost only $4.99, but transactions worth over $1,000 will be free of charge. 

Facebook set to train youths on e-marketing https://goo.gl/KNWTns

Facebook will provide training on digital marketing under its ‘Boost Your Business’ programme to 10,000 information technology-trained Bangladeshi youths within the next six months. Media reports, quoting experts, said programmes like Facebook's `#BoostYourBusiness' would contribute to encourage entrepreneurship and provide global visibility which would help the growth of business and boost economy of the country. To transform the future of the nation into a technologically advanced one by 2021, the current government has been implementing an array of measures to build up an IT skilled workforce. 

E-procurement begins a new phase https://goo.gl/qvepdD

The World Bank has renewed its partnership with Bangladesh on establishing transparency and accountability in public purchases and improving the overall government procurement management in the country. The new phase of the project will aim to restructure and institutionalise the e-GP as part of efforts to improve overall public procurement management. Other goals include enhancing digitisation of public procurement, professiona-lisation of procurement and citizen engagement and digitising project implementation monitoring.The first phase of the project concluded recently and introduced electronic procurement, known as e-GP, in 2010.

Ashikur, you have 1 new notification
Hi there,

When we talked with recent graduates of our immersive Pro Intensives, we learned that the community — the group of Codecademy learners who complete a Pro Intensive together — was one of the main differentiators that helped them get to the finish line. Working together, they were able to complete difficult exercises and understand challenging topics better and faster than they could do alone.

For example, learners who enroll in Build
Front-End Web Apps ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_11_14_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) receive an invite to join a private Slack channel at the start of the Pro Intensive so that they can chat with their peers. Our graduates report that this channel, which a Codecademy Pro Advisor moderates, is one of their favorite resources for receiving help and support throughout the 8-week Pro Intensive.

While our Pro Intensives conclude after only a few exhilarating weeks, the informal support network and the friendships created do not. Your community of Codecademy Pro Intensive learners will be available to you for years to come, no extra cost.

A close, collaborative community isn't just better for learning, it's how professional coders get the job done. So, are you ready to get coding, together? Start by learning how to Build Front-End Web Apps ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_11_14_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) — our Pro Intensive that we designed to quickly teach you how to build your first real-world web applications.

Complete your enrollment today to secure your seat in our next cohort that begins on November 14th:

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_11_14_17&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=enroll_now_link )

Codecademy
