Hey there,
 
Building a world-class API is expensive—and so is working with engineers. Especially if you don’t know the true price of what you’re asking for.
 
By learning to speak your team’s language, you can reduce timelines, costs, and holdups—and get better results. Our new Pro Intensive, Build Web APIs From Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-web-apis-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=api_4_10_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ), is perfect for project managers who are looking to gain that edge.
 
This course is ideal even for those with little or no back-end coding experience. In just eight weeks, you’ll:
* Learn the language your engineering team lives and breathes. Discover how back-end APIs interact with databases and the browser to produce dynamic content.

* Build a fast and scalable API using Express.js, the JavaScript framework that powers Twitter, PayPal, and Uber, among many other applications.

* Experience the development process from your engineering team’s point of view by developing three projects from scratch that professional programmers will review.

Gain back-end skills and become a project manager who truly “gets it.” Secure your seat in our next cohort of Build Web APIs From Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-web-apis-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=api_4_10_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ). It starts on April 10th.

Ashikur, you have 50 new notifications
BANGLADESH INSIGHT | Apr 01, 2018

http://www.albd.org/

Apr 01, 2018

https://goo.gl/sa1PdH

https://goo.gl/sa1PdHHPM Sheikh Hasina calls BIMSTEC security chiefs to root out terrorism

Honourable Prime Minister (HPM) Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has called for uprooting all forms of terrorism to establish a secure and prosperous Bay of Bengal region. She made the call when the national security chiefs of the BIMSTEC countries saw her at her residence in Dhaka last week. The national security chiefs of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation or BIMSTEC are now in Dhaka for their second conference. They have discussed security cooperation issues among the seven member states of the regional grouping. The Bangladesh Premier was hopeful that the BIMSTEC countries will strengthen their cooperation to stamp out terrorism from the region.

Bangladesh will benefit from LDC graduation: UN https://goo.gl/DvpoBK

During a recent visit to Bangladesh, UN Assistant Secretary-General Haoliang Xu said the UN sees a “lot of benefits” of Bangladesh once it officially graduates to a developing country by 2024. As a LDC the signal to investor community is that it is not the best place for investment, the envoy said, adding that the graduation would send strong message to investors that Bangladesh is a right place for investments. After graduation, the rating agency will rate Bangladesh higher in the rating for investments and what that means that the cost of investment in Bangladesh will be significantly lower, if the volume is significantly larger. Bangladesh, which has been an LDC since 1975, recently fulfilled the UN’s current criteria to graduate from a ‘least developed country’ to a ‘developing country’. Bangladesh has also recently advanced from a low-income country to a low-middle income country on the World Bank’s scale.

Trump lauds HPM Sheikh Hasina’s personal leadership in addressing Rohingya plight https://goo.gl/9jYusn

US President Donald Trump has lauded HPM Sheikh Hasina’s personal leadership in addressing the plight of Rohingya who fled to Bangladesh from Myanmar. In a message to HPM on Bangladesh’s Independence Day he also thanked the prime minister for giving shelter to Rohingya men, women and children. “Your personal leadership has been critical to addressing the plight of the Rohingya who fled to safety in your country. I thank you for all you have done to assist these men, women and children in need,” he wrote in the message.

Rohingya Return: PM calls for keeping up pressure on Myanmar https://goo.gl/3vWky9

HPM Sheikh Hasina reiterated her call to the international community to continue pressurising the Myanmar government to take back its nationals from Bangladesh. She made the call when WHO-SEARO Regional Director Poonam Khetrapal Singh met her at the Gono Bhaban. Meanwhile, the government has prepared the second list of around 10,000 Rohingyas for repatriation. Bangladesh government is likely to sign a deal with the UNHCR this week https://goo.gl/JU5vwH to facilitate the repatriation of Rohingyas as well as to ensure safe and voluntary return of the Myanmar nationals to their home.

https://goo.gl/dPKgv2

GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT

https://goo.gl/njnhd7

https://goo.gl/njnhd7Fish production up by 1.2 million tonnes in 8 years

Fish production in the country increased by 1.2 million tonnes in eight years as a result of various effective programmes taken by the present government. In 2009-10, the total fish production was 2.8 million tonnes while it was 3 million tonnes in 2010-11, 3.6. million tonnes in 2014-15, 3.8 million tonnes in 2015-16 and 4.1 million tonnes in 2016-17. According to Bangladesh Economic Survey-2017, 23.81% of total agriculture income comes from fisheries sector. The major programmes for increasing fish production are the expansion and strengthening of community-based fish cultivation programme, ensuring access of fish cultivators to khas wetlands, taking marshland nurturing program and release of fish fries to water bodies and promoting innovative technology through research works.

EBEK benefits over 10 million poor https://goo.gl/8yQ9xj

Over 16.5 million poor and extreme-poor people across the country are being benefitted from the present government's One House One Farm known as "Ektee Bari, Ektee Khamar (EBEK)" project, one of the 10 priority initiatives of HPM Sheikh Hasina. Under the project, a total of 67,757 'Village Development Associations' (VDAs) have been formed across the country from which about 3.3 million families are getting benefits. The beneficiaries have deposited over Taka 1,221.58 crore till December 2017 and the government has provided financial assistance as grant under the project.

WB approves $15m for improving nat'l statistics https://goo.gl/YhsfWW

The World Bank approved a US $15 million financing to help Bangladesh produce timely and quality statistics. This will help the country make more evidence-based policy decisions. The National Strategy for Development of Statistics Implementation Support Project will improve the capacity of Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS) to produce and disseminate quality statistics in a timely manner. The credit is interest-free and repayable in 38 years, including a 6-year grace period, and carries a service charge of 0.75%.

Eight new plants for $300m https://goo.gl/qQTxZX

The government has invested $300 million to set up eight new factories at its newly-built two economic zones at Meghnaghat in Narayanganj. The new factories, which will take the group's total industrial units to 40, will create 3,500 jobs. The new units, which will be inaugurated on Saturday, are for: beverage, edible oil refinery, tissue, pulp and paper, flour, chemicals, cement fibre, steel fabricate mills and a 40 megawatt power plant. 

TRADE AND INVSETMENT

https://goo.gl/JLPRPJ

Bangladesh, Luxembourg businesses explore possible convergence in sectors of common interest https://goo.gl/JLPRPJ

Bangladesh and Luxembourg businesses have explored the possible convergence in sectors of common interest as both countries eye strengthening the trade ties. This was precisely the main purpose of the second meeting of the recently concluded Luxembourg Business Council in Bangladesh (LBCB) in Dhaka, Honorary Consul of Luxembourg and Convener of the Council Nasreen Zamir told media outlets. Financial sector collaboration, particularly in banking, is a major area that Dhaka is looking to explore with Luxembourg. 

First mother vessel reaches Ctg port from Korea https://goo.gl/796CoE

A new way for container transport was introduced from Korea to Chittagong port last week, which would help traders to cut the travel time by a half. For the first time, a mother vessel carried containers from Korea to the Bangladeshi port in 14 days. It used to take around 30 days, as the containers had to wait in Singapore port to be unloaded and to reach Chittagong through feeder vessels. It was a longtime demand of the port users to introduce this type of container transport, which would save time for both the importers and the exporter. 

INTERNATIONAL AND REGIONAL COOPERATION

https://goo.gl/wZERud

MoU signed with Japan for arsenic mitigation, sustainable construction https://goo.gl/wZERud

Bangladesh and Japan signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to conduct joint researches on sustainable construction and mitigation of arsenic from drinking water in the country. Bangladesh Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (BCSIR) and Japanese JDC Corporation inked the MoU at a function at the BCSIR seminar room. The researches will be conducted to use the 'Twister' and 'JaPani' technologies invented by JDC for sustainable construction and mitigation of arsenic from drinking water. Under the MoU, one mini plant will be set up at an arsenic affected area to test the effectiveness of the 'JaPani' Technology in mitigating arsenic from drinking water and another mini plant will be installed on 'Twister' technology at a suitable place. 

Dhaka expresses concern at recent missile attacks by Houthis https://goo.gl/9WE5Bw

Bangladesh conveyed its deep concern at the recent multiple ballistic missile attacks by the Houthi rebels aimed at Riyadh and other bordering cities of South Western parts of Saudi Arabia. The missile attacks were however successfully intercepted by the Saudi Air Defence forces. Bangladesh staunchly opposes such unilateral acts by the Houthi rebels. These are provocative acts and have an adverse impact on regional peace and stability, according to a foreign ministry statement said.

Building Amazon Alexa skills that feel like real conversations. Explaining the Cambridge Analytica scandal, machine learning, and data mining.

Newsletter #46April 5, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

How to Build Amazon Alexa Skills That Sound Natural ( http://news.codecademy.com/alexa-skills-sound-natural/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB )

--------------------------------------
Build Alexa Skills that Understand You
--------------------------------------

Whether it’s a conversation with an Amazon Alexa device or a friend named Alexa, we don’t want to think twice about how our words will be interpreted. That’s why we teamed up with Amazon to help you build natural, voice-first Alexa experiences that feel like talking to a friend who understands you.

To celebrate our new course and the possibilities it unlocks, we shared what makes a good voice interface, what the field of voice design might look like in a few years, and how you can play a part in that shift.

READ ON ( http://news.codecademy.com/alexa-skills-sound-natural/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB )

In Other News

A Teachable Moment
------------------

The Cambridge Analytica scandal is a little confusing, so our team broke down the tech behind the data breach ( http://news.codecademy.com/cambridge-analytica-machine-learning-facebook-data/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB ). See the not-so-great side of machine learning.

Get to Learning
---------------

Eager to start polishing your voice design skills? Jump right into ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/alexa-conversational-design/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB ) the new Alexa course.

Revamped Dashboard
------------------

We gave our dashboard a new look. Take a tour ( http://news.codecademy.com/updates-to-the-codecademy-dashboard/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB ) of your new home base that makes it easier to get back to coding.

From Codecademy to Y Combinator
-------------------------------

You may have seen our profile ( http://news.codecademy.com/y-combinator-tipe-patrick-stapleton/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-5-18&utm_content=ConvWithAlexaNB ) of a Codecademy alum whose company recently launched at YC’s Demo Day. This week, Business Insider also profiled Patrick ( http://www.businessinsider.com/how-tipeio-founder-patrick-stapleton-learned-to-code-got-accepted-into-y-combinator-2018-3?utm_source=CodecademyNewsletter ).

Hey there,
 
If you’re still designing static websites using HTML and CSS, we’ve got bad news and good news.
 
The bad news is you’re stuck in the 90s. Today’s customers demand interactive web experiences. To deliver, companies need developers who know their way around the front end of the development stack.
 
The good news is that we can bring you up to 2018—in just eight weeks. Our new Pro Intensive, Build Front-End Web Apps ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_4_17_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ), quickly takes you from no front-end coding experience to building beautiful web apps. Along the way, you’ll:
* Work with professional programmers to see how rich content gets built in companies such as Netflix and Airbnb.

* Learn to build robust, interactive web apps using the JavaScript library ReactJS—one of the most in-demand technical skills in the industry*.
* Complete three projects from scratch that you’ll be proud to include in your job search portfolio.

Gain the front-end coding skills employers are looking for. Join our next session of Build Front-End Web Apps ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_4_17_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ). It starts on April 17th.

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/build-frontend-web-apps-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=bwa_4_17_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_link )

Your Career + Code ( https://www.codecademy.com/skill-up/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_content=header-graphic-link )

 

 

Skill Up to Stand Out

It’s no secret: technical skills are changing the workplace. This was the founding premise for Codecademy, and our mission has always been to give you the knowledge you need to get ahead. In 2012 that meant teaching programming to an audience who wanted to become software engineers.
Today, things have changed, and you’ve probably felt it. In a world where automation is expected to displace millions of jobs, the question isn’t “will you learn to code,” it’s when. Our research shows that technical skills aren’t just for the
engineers anymore. They’re for the marketers, designers, analysts and entrepreneurs, and more. In the future of work, everyone will have to learn to code.
We’re here to help. Explore Your Career + Code ( https://codecademy.com/skill-up?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=career-hub-launch&utm_content=inline-link ), our interactive experience that shows you exactly how to develop your career with code. Take our quiz to learn more about the technical revolution, and then discover how you can get started and level up your career.

Explore Your Career + Code ( https://codecademy.com/skill-up?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=career-hub-launch&utm_content=inline-link )

Program appliances with Python; Your Career + Code; the benefits of note-taking

Newsletter #47April 23, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

All the (Internet of) Things ( https://news.codecademy.com/internet-of-things/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )

------------
What Is IoT?
------------

In 1982, a group of Carnegie Mellon computer scientists wanted to check the inventory of their soda vending machine without leaving their desks. They came up with a solution that was revolutionary at the time—they connected the machine to the internet.

In 2018, you don’t have to be a computer science PhD to set up a smart vending machine. You can thank Limor “Ladyada” Fried for that change. She’s the founder and CEO of Adafruit Industries, a company that makes hardware programming and the Internet of Things accessible to everyone.

She wrote an article for us in which she explains:

* What the term “Internet of Things” actually means
* The IoT projects she’s most excited about
* The programming language she recommends learning (hint hint: ?)

READ ON ( https://news.codecademy.com/internet-of-things/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )

In Other News

( https://www.codecademy.com/skill-up/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )

Explore Your Career + Code
--------------------------

We launched a tool to show you exactly how learning to code can help you upgrade your career. Poke around the site ( https://www.codecademy.com/skill-up/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT ) and be sure to take the quiz ( https://www.codecademy.com/skill-up/quiz?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/inspect-element-howto/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )

Let's Get Meta
------------------

Browser developer tools let you peek under the hood of any webpage. Modify our interactive article ( https://news.codecademy.com/inspect-element-howto/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT ) to see just how powerful these tools can be.

( https://news.codecademy.com/make-a-website-codecademy-notes/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )

Community Notes
---------------

( https://news.codecademy.com/make-a-website-codecademy-notes/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )While you take a course to gain new skills, take notes to reinforce them. Check out one learner's ( https://news.codecademy.com/make-a-website-codecademy-notes/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT )notes on our "Make a Website" course ( https://news.codecademy.com/make-a-website-codecademy-notes/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT ), and then try it out yourself ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/make-a-website/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_4-23-18&utm_content=IoT ).

Take your Python skills to the next level – one of the most versatile skill sets in programming. You'll have the ability to do everything from bringing a dream app idea to life to conducting a sorely needed data analysis, and much more.

***********************
Programming with Python
***********************

First Session Starts May 8th.Limited seats available!

LEARN MORE ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_05_08_18_not_engaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=top_cta )

Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_05_08_18_not_engaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=img )
Apply natural language processing with Python to solve a murder mystery case.

In our newest Pro Intensive, Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_05_08_18_not_engaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ), you’ll quickly gain the fundamentals you need to develop a career in web development or machine learning.

Over the course of 9 weeks, you'll learn how to:

* Factor your code into reusable components and write complex programs with branching logic.

* Parse and process blocks of text quickly and easily.

* Write a program that analyzes various writing samples, helping a detective identify a murder suspect along the way.

Take your Python skills to the next level. In just a few weeks, you'll be able to confidently write Python code – giving you one of the most versatile skill sets in programming. Don't wait to secure your spot in our first session! It begins May 8th.

LEARN MORE ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_05_08_18_not_engaged&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_cta )

How to make the most of Python communities; 3 new courses; beating automation

Newsletter #48May 10, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

All the (Internet of) Things ( https://news.codecademy.com/python-community/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities )

---------------------------------------
Learn Python with Friends & Mentors
---------------------------------------

What would our school days have been without our best friends and favorite teachers? Being a student is more rewarding with a community to inspire us, hold us accountable, and push us forward.

That’s why we explained how to find and make the most of a supportive community while learning Python, or any other programming language.

From in-person meetups to online forums with tens of thousands of active members, these groups will get you there faster—and you’ll have more fun along the way.

READ ON ( https://news.codecademy.com/python-community/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities )

In Other News

( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/data-visualization-with-python?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities )

New Courses
-----------

Ninety-three percent of Pro Intensive grads say the course helped their career, so we made more of them. Learn Programming with
Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities ), Data Visualization ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/data-visualization-with-python?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities ), and SQL ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/app-store-automation-changeup/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities )

From Accountant to App Store
----------------------------

Rafael Reis was in an industry that was being “wiped out by technology,” so he took his future into his own hands and learned to
code ( https://news.codecademy.com/app-store-automation-changeup/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/skip-though-course-content-and-jump-to-individual-lessons/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities )

Skip Through Course Content
---------------------------

We heard you! We've unlocked all of our lesson content. ( https://news.codecademy.com/skip-though-course-content-and-jump-to-individual-lessons/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-10-18&utm_content=PythonCommunities ) Skip to the lesson that's right for your experience level, or direct your classroom to a specific lesson.

Hello HackerRank Community,

 

Thank you for trusting HackerRank as your destination to improve your coding skills.

We value your privacy and want to be transparent about the data we collect, how we use it and your rights to control that information. We've updated our [Privacy Policy](http://email.postmaster.hackerrank.com/c/eJxdjbEOgyAURb9GRsJ7PIoMDB30NwylWIyiBGlN_762Y5Mz3JzhnrvVKFo2WRTQCgWAiEZoDvyKRL0E7IzUfadUQyJve01ur6Hw6PwcSnHrzP2WWLTtxYwBjPIKRhc0AXnC26jAGyEIiS021pobeW2wPzmO4-_klLlML-ffrNj63GMoc3Sr0vJMP5Kbll-q2u8cakh5cTUMgBo_CZ89Dg) and  [Terms of Service](http://email.postmaster.hackerrank.com/c/eJxdjkEOgyAURE8jO8nnA2IXLFzoNQwiFqOoAVqvX9plk1m8zOLNzFohtGTVCKwFyRgiPkBRRjsUYuAM-wdXQy9lJeA6Uw4mZRepN3ZzMZpjo_YMxGuQfAIuUFklF0QpsIFmFryRCzgzcbJrn_NV8a7CoeS-7z9JKYs5pPpc6uTie7WORJ1fybu4eXNIxcuHZzDr_tvM-otjduHaTXYjQ4UfBhM_6Q) to provide more security around your personal data and to reflect the high standards established by the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), a set of laws passed in the European Union. We've also updated our [Cookie Policy](http://email.postmaster.hackerrank.com/c/eJxdjj0OwyAUg08TxggeEMLAkCG5RvRCaYnyAwLaqLcv7VjJsqxvsH0zCmhPVgOU9VQyBgCaqpa1AwgxcQaj5moapWwEjSGXA3NxqfVoN5cSnltrw0G8WbTgbNFUc5S9EJZxqzsq4F7NaezIbnwpseFDA1PVdV1_JRXGtL7QvhvgNoRtdZkkU57Zu7R5PKXi9cTjwHX_jRbzjXNxR9yxuJmBgg9Jn0Am) to clarify that we use cookies to provide you with a better experience. We've implemented these updates globally because, at HackerRank, we believe everyone in our community has the right to these protections.

If you have any questions about these changes, please check our [FAQs](http://email.postmaster.hackerrank.com/c/eJxdjrEOwjAMRL-m3ahsJyHtkIGB_gYywZCqaalS8_-kjEinu6cb7HsET9C3UyDAHhwiEQ3gO-wuZO1okK6D8ePVucbC9t514V2ldInjLKXwOnfxvbQpyIMc9I7JuoHweTdsTAUfUc5PW1_kkFS3xlwaGquS5O3vytHGarKePntNLjrFLAeaMwAguQGtb0vQz56kzIlX500d9lp4yr8hGg68qSxbZpUbkqcv82VEYw). For any other questions, you can email us at  [privacy@hackerrank.com](mailto:privacy@hackerrank.com). Thank you for being a part of our developer community.

 

Happy coding!

The team at HackerRank

Rajib Adrian, Shimon Mehzabeen and 8 others are new friend suggestions for you
tusherkhan573@gmail.com

This month, we’re updating our Privacy Policy to make it easier for you to  
understand what information we collect and why we collect it. We’ve also  
taken steps to improve our Privacy Checkup and other controls we provide to  
safeguard your data and protect your privacy.

Nothing is changing about your current settings or how your information is  
processed. Rather, we’ve improved the way we describe our practices and how  
we explain the options you have to update, manage, export, and delete your  
data.

We’re making these updates as new data protection regulations come into  
effect in the European Union, and we’re taking the opportunity to make  
improvements for Google users around the world.

Making our Privacy Policy easier to understand

Simpler structure & clearer language

We’ve improved the navigation and organization of the policy to make it  
easier to find what you’re looking for. We’ve also explained our practices  
in more detail and with clearer language.

New descriptive videos & illustrations

Often a visual description is easier to understand than text alone, so  
we’ve added short videos and illustrations throughout the policy.

Embedded privacy controls

We’ve made it easier to jump to key settings directly from the policy,  
helping you make choices about your privacy.

The revised policy is available here  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=tusherkhan573%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fpolicies.google.com%2Fprivacy%2Fupdate%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
and will take effect on May 25, 2018.

Improving your privacy controls

Within the past year, we updated My Activity  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=tusherkhan573%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyactivity.google.com%2Fmyactivity%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
so that you can better access and manage the data in your Google Account.  
We also launched a redesigned Dashboard  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=tusherkhan573%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2Fdashboard%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>,  
which allows you to easily see an overview of products you’re using and  
your data associated with them.

This month, we’ve updated our Privacy Checkup  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=tusherkhan573%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2Fprivacycheckup%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
with new illustrations and examples to help you make more informed choices  
about your key privacy controls. And since we understand that your  
preferences may change over time, the new Privacy Checkup enables you to  
sign up for regular reminders to check your privacy settings.

To learn more about these and other controls to manage your privacy, visit  
your Google Account  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=tusherkhan573%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2F%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>.

(c) 2018 Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to tusherkhan573@gmail.com to provide an update about  
your Google Account.

Paresh Das, ???? ??????? ?????? and 8 others are new friend suggestions for you
Hey there, 

Know that data wiz everyone in the office relies on? Maybe you've asked this person to check your numbers before your performance review or watched your boss rely on them for the quarterly forecasts. They're likely constantly busy and often have someone asking them a question.

Being the data wiz means being in demand, and not just in the office. LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/skills-companies-need-most-2018-courses-get-them-paul-petrone/?trk=li_corpblog_jobs_skills_2018 ) ranked statistical analysis and data mining as the second most in-demand skill in 2018. That's why we built our newest Pro Intensive: Learn SQL from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_5_22_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ). This course will help you become the go-to for data questions in just 6 weeks. SQL is a language that gives you access to databases and the ability to manipulate and analyze large sets of data faster and with more precision than Excel ( https://news.codecademy.com/excel-to-sql-why-switch/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_5_22_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ).

In Learn SQL from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_5_22_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) we teach anyone the SQL skills they need to run business analyses. Whether you have no experience with data, are an analyst working in Excel, or are a marketer struggling with lead attribution, it's time to learn SQL.

In this course, you'll learn how to:
* Use data to analyze a marketing funnel and calculate conversion rates
* Summarize large quantities of data into easy-to-read tables
* Combine data from multiple different sources to draw advanced conclusions

Go from no analytical experience to using big data to make big decisions in 6 weeks. Sign up now for Learn SQL from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_5_22_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) starting May 29th.

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_5_22_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link )

Newsletter #49May 25, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

How to Hack Hacker News ( https://news.codecademy.com/how-to-hack-hacker-news/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-24-18&utm_content=HackHN )

--------------------------
Use SQL to Top Hacker News
--------------------------

If you’re in or around tech, you've probably dreamed of reaching the front page of Hacker News. Capturing this community’s attention can translate into thousands of views and, more importantly, street cred.

But launching an amazing new product or sharing a compelling article doesn’t always guarantee a spot on the front page. That's why we built something to help you rise to the top.

With a real dataset from Hacker News and a few SQL queries, we discovered what the most successful posts on the site have in common. True to form, we’ll teach you how to use SQL to discover them yourself. Read on to learn:

* Whether or not it’s important to be a “power user”
* Which sources Hacker News users are most likely to upvote
* The best time of day to make a submission

READ ON ( https://news.codecademy.com/how-to-hack-hacker-news/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-24-18&utm_content=HackHN )

In Other News

( https://news.codecademy.com/learn-javascript-requests/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-24-18&utm_content=HackHN )

Javascript.”

( https://news.codecademy.com/excel-to-sql-why-switch/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-24-18&utm_content=HackHN )

Leave Excel Behind
------------------

Excel is the go-to tool for manipulating and analyzing data, but it’s far from perfect. We explained how to use SQL as a faster, easier, and safer
alternative. ( https://news.codecademy.com/excel-to-sql-why-switch/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_5-24-18&utm_content=HackHN )

How to Hack Hacker News





    Hello there,



    As of May 25 2018, the privacy laws in Europe have changed and the General Data Protection Regulation (or GDPR) is now in effect. To support this change, we have updated our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. These updates are part of HackerEarth’s ongoing effort to provide transparency and safeguard your privacy.

What's changed? 


 Nothing about the type of data that HackerEarth collects and how it uses this data has changed. HackerEarth does not share your data with anyone for any purpose without your consent, except for the specific reasons listed in our Privacy Policy.
        



        We have updated our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service to make it easier for you to understand what data we collect and what it's used for.
        



            It is important that you understand and comply with the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). This includes how we store, process, and delete personal data. Learn more, here.
        



    These updates will automatically come into effect for all existing users on May 25 2018. Your continued use of our products from this day will be subject to these updates, and therefore, we encourage you to read and understand our policies.


    If you have any questions or comments, send us a message at support@hackerearth.com.


Regards
Team HackerEarth



This email is a legal requirement, which is why you are receiving this email even though you may have unsubscribed from emails from HackerEarth.




Updated Privacy Policy and Terms of Service
Dear Customer,
We’ve updated the Steam Privacy Policy to be clearer about our use of customer
information.  The following are highlights of our changes:
  * We’ve incorporated concepts from the EU General Data Protection Regulation
(GDPR) including the EU and Swiss Privacy Shield frameworks.
  * We’ve added explanations for why Valve processes customer data and the types
of data that we process, as well as information about your data protection
rights.
For more information about our privacy practices, please review the new Privacy
Policy found on the Steam website.


Steam Privacy Policy Update
Hey there,

If you’ve never written a line of code, you might be wondering, "Where should I start?"

Python.

Over the last few years, Python has grown to become the most popular programming language* — and for good reason. Learning Python will set you up to do programming work of all kinds — including in fast-growing fields like Data Science, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. This is the reason we decided to create a new Pro Intensive, Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_05_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ), which teaches introductory Python programming skills that you'll be able to apply to something you'll love.

Our extensive Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_05_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) curriculum will help you learn:
* Foundational programming concepts such as code organization and re-use

* Object-oriented programming principles such as inheritance

* How to use Natural Language Processing (NLP) to solve a murder mystery (spooky!)

Make your intro to programming easy with Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_05_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ). You’ll get immediate feedback on your projects and professional code reviews from instructors who know how to give advice that will help you grow.

Secure your seat in our next session — it begins on June 5th.

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_05_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_link )

Meet the CEO of Codecademy ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=gdpr_update&utm_medium=email&utm_content=hero_image )

 

 

General Data Protection Regulation

 

Dear Codecademy User,

 

As you may have heard, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) went into effect on May 25th, 2018. Codecademy strongly believes in the rights of users to control their data. We have updated our privacy policy ( https://www.codecademy.com/policy#gdpr-faq ) to reflect that belief.

 

In summary, we never sell your data to third parties directly or via advertising. We also minimize the amount of personal data that we process and store.

 

If you have questions, please visit our help center ( https://help.codecademy.com/hc/en-us/articles/360005267373?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=gdpr_update&utm_medium=email&utm_content=inline_link ) to contact our team. If you would like to modify your email settings, you can do so on your mail settings ( https://www.codecademy.com/account/mail_settings?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=gdpr_update&utm_medium=email&utm_content=inline_link ) page.

 

Happy learning!

 

Codecademy

 

Please note that this is not a marketing email. This is a notice that is legally required to be sent to all Codecademy users, even if they have opted out of our marketing communications.

 

 

 

codecademy ( https://www.codecademy.com?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=gdpr_update&utm_medium=email&utm_content=bottom_logo )

Update to our Privacy Policy
How to put your skills on display; new-look homepage; API Season

Newsletter #50June 6, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

How to Add Codecademy to Your Resume ( https://news.codecademy.com/technical-resume-on-angellist-tips/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume )

Completing a Codecademy course is no small feat. After learning, internalizing, and practicing complex technical concepts, you owe it to yourself to reap the rewards. Show the world the courses you’ve completed and the skills you’ve mastered, then see a change in your career.

To help you get there faster, we asked the experts at AngelList and Paysa for advice. Read on for tips on why, how, and when to add Codecademy skills to your resume and online career profiles. You'll learn:

* The difference between “Basic” and “Intermediate” coding skills
* Why you should update your resume when you’re not looking for a job
* The impact of tech skills on job prospects for “non-technical” roles

Read On ( https://news.codecademy.com/technical-resume-on-angellist-tips/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume )

In Other News

( https://news.codecademy.com/why-is-coding-so-hard-part-1/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume )

Debugging the Learning Process
------------------------------

Pat's a programming teacher who wants you to know that you’re not alone. He shared his students' most common challenges ( https://news.codecademy.com/why-is-coding-so-hard-part-1/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume ) and how to overcome them.

( https://news.codecademy.com/what-to-know-about-apis/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume )

API Madness
-----------

Google, Microsoft, and Apple all held their developer conferences in the past month. In other words, it’s API Season. Our explainer cuts through the jargon ( https://news.codecademy.com/what-to-know-about-apis/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume ).

( https://www.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume )

Brand New Homepage
------------------

We gave our homepage a new look and feel—now it’s easier than ever to sign up and start coding. Check it out ( https://www.codecademy.com/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_6-6-18&utm_content=CCtoResume ) and then tell a friend.

Tips from AngelList on adding Codecademy to your resume
From self-driving cars to voice-recognizing assistants, artificial intelligence (AI) shows up somewhere new every day, even places we don’t expect. You might not believe it, but big brands publish news stories to social media written and dictated by an artificially intelligent machine. AI is not only here to stay, but evidently here to extend its reach into every corner of life. But where did this AI boom come from?

A large part of AI’s resurgence is the result of programmers building on open-source numerical computing libraries, such as NumPy, to create tools that implement Machine Learning algorithms, such as Scikit-learn and TensorFlow. And what do all these tools have in common? They're built in Python.

Python enables Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, and Full-Stack Web Development. Due to its versatility, you’ll find Python amid job descriptions for a wide range of in-demand roles: data scientists, machine learning engineers, and even product managers. And people already in those roles agree: when compared to its strictly typed and syntax-heavy peers Java and C++, Python is much easier to learn.

If you’ve ever considered learning to program but weren’t sure where to start, Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_19_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) is for you. This course introduces you to programming best practices, computer science concepts, and more all done in Python, the world’s most popular programming language.

In this nine-week Pro Intensive designed for beginners, you will learn to code, but you will also…
* Build a customer service chatbot.

* Create a Good Reads-style book platform.

* Use Natural Language Processing (NLP) to solve a murder mystery.

Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_19_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) helps you build a solid coding foundation and begin your journey toward machine learning, app development, and beyond. Due to the individualized feedback provided to each student, limited seats are available, so enroll today.

Your Python journey begins on June 19th ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_6_19_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_link ).

Codecademy

Ashikur, you have 18 new notifications
Nope, that subject line is not a glitch. But if it left you confused, let’s clear that up right now.

The subject of this email is a query written in Structured Query Language (SQL). If executed on a relational database named ‘all_job_skills,’ it would return a list of every skill name in the database sorted by demand. According to Monster.com, sitting in the 4th spot would be, (you probably guessed it), SQL.1

Demand for professionals with the ability to use SQL has grown dramatically over the last decade — and for good reason. Organizations of all kinds, from local nonprofits to multinational corporations, have realized that accessing and analyzing data can make them more effective and efficient. As a consequence, open roles requiring knowledge of SQL are now the roles that companies are working the hardest to fill.

That’s where Codecademy fits into the picture.

If you want to make data-driven decisions in your work, turn to our brand new Learn SQL from Scratch ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_7_3_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) Pro Intensive. We designed this new Intensive to teach you how to analyze data using SQL and then develop meaningful insights that move your organization forward.

Over six weeks, you will comb through data from multiple sources to discover valuable insights. For example, our real-life projects teach you how to:
* Determine which marketing efforts actually deliver results
* Uncover the optimal time to publish a news article
* Run queries that aggregate data about a product’s usage
Along the way, you will learn how to translate your own ideas into evidence-backed business decisions — all by analyzing databases with SQL.

Don't wait to get going:

Enroll Today ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/learn-sql-from-scratch?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=sql_7_3_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_link )

Codecademy

What remote companies are looking for; new Alexa course; the difference between "programming" and "coding"

Newsletter #51July 2, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Use Tech Skills to Land a Remote Job ( https://news.codecademy.com/at-home-jobs-remote-work?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-2-18&utm_content=RemoteJobs )

When you think of “remote work,” what comes to mind? Galavanting around the world’s coffee shops with a laptop and a dream? Spending as much time with the kids as possible while thriving professionally? Bringing that side project to life while holding down a steady job?

Whatever your vision, we’re here to help. We combed through open job listings at remote-only companies, researched what makes their employees successful, and discovered which technical skills you need to make remote work your reality.

So whether your goal is to freelance, start a company from home, or work for a fully-remote company, read on to learn the ins and outs of remote work.

Read On ( https://news.codecademy.com/at-home-jobs-remote-work?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-2-18&utm_content=RemoteJobs )

-----------------------------------------

Python (red), the most popular programming language on StackOverflow in 2017.

JavaScript has been dethroned by the world’s new chief programming language: Python. And due to Python's association with rapidly growing fields such as Data Science and Machine Learning, its growth is unlikely to slow soon.

But coding, especially in Python, is not limited to burgeoning technical fields. Professionals of all kinds who learn Python improve their careers by using code to simplify and optimize their work-life. For example, you can use Python to:
* Automate manual reporting tasks

* Scrape data from web pages

* Export data into spreadsheets

* Create beautiful data visualizations
“We can do it in Python,” just might become your new catch-phrase, and Codecademy can definitely help you make it ring true. Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_7_17_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) is our nine-week Intensive that we designed to introduce you to Python's powerful capabilities. * Write code that is robust and scalable

* Use Natural Language Processing to solve a murder mystery

Are you ready to learn one of the world’s fastest-growing programming languages and level up your career?

Your Python journey begins July 17th.

Bite-sized Coding Tips

 

We know that learning to code can be tough! That's why we wanted to give you some tips on how to make as much progress as possible.

 

 

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=3_days_lapsed&utm_medium=email&utm_content=icon_habit )

 

Make it a habit.

 

If you code a little bit every day, or on the same day every week, you'll find it much easier to keep going!

 

 

 

( https://www.codecademy.com/stories/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=3_days_lapsed&utm_medium=email&utm_content=icon_inspiration )

 

Know what inspires you.

 

If you can make learning to code a part of a bigger goal, it will be easier to push through whenever you are starting to feel frustrated!

 

 

 

( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=3_days_lapsed&utm_medium=email&utm_content=icon_help )

 

Consider more help.

 

Codecademy Pro provides more support for learners, with advanced courses and live help from advisors. Advisors can help you when you're stuck, or tell you what you should learn next.

How we wrote the latest Alexa course; why JavaScript is more important than ever; add us to your top 8

Newsletter #52July 19, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

MySpace and the Coding Legacy it Left Behind ( https://news.codecademy.com/myspace-coding-legacy?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly )

Ah, MySpace. Glittering backgrounds, auto-playing music, and, of course, the politics of the top 8. MySpace introduced many of us to social media, and perhaps more importantly, to the world of code.

Tom taught millions of people basic HTML and CSS through the MySpace profile editor. The site topped 100 million active users at its peak, so that’s a lot of people tinkering with a lot of style and img tags.

Join us as we look back on MySpace’s role in introducing an entire generation to code. The site may no longer have the relevance it once did, but the web development skills it taught us have never been more important.

Read On ( https://news.codecademy.com/myspace-coding-legacy?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly )

In Other News

( https://news.codecademy.com/future-of-work/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly )

Back to the Future of Work
--------------------------

You get it—tech is changing how we work. We skipped the doom-and-gloom robot takeover talk and explained how coding can prepare you for an uncertain
future ( https://news.codecademy.com/future-of-work/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly ).

( https://www.codecademy.com/courses/learn-javascript-introduction/lessons/introduction-to-javascript/exercises/intro?action=resume_content_item&course_redirect=introduction-to-javascript?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly )

Why JavaScript?
---------------

JavaScript is as essential as HTML and CSS in modern web development. MySpace may no longer be around to introduce this generation to it, but we definitely are ( https://www.codecademy.com/courses/learn-javascript-introduction/lessons/introduction-to-javascript/exercises/intro?action=resume_content_item&course_redirect=introduction-to-javascript?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/test-conversations-alexa-dialog-management/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly )

Coding a Coding Course
----------------------

Ever wondered how Codecademy curriculum developers create courses? Here's a behind
the scenes look ( https://news.codecademy.com/test-conversations-alexa-dialog-management/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_7-19-18&utm_content=MySpaceFortnightly ) at how we wrote our newest Alexa course.

tusher, your new Samsung Galaxy S8 doesn't have the latest Google apps
TechRepublic, an online community of IT professionals, recently asked developers to rank the easiest-to-learn coding languages. The overwhelming response: HTML.

However, if you're just beginning your coding journey, this response is deceiving. There is a key difference between coding languages that is helpful to know:
* If you want to present data, you need to use a markup language. Examples: HTML, XML, Markdown

* If you want to mediate data between programs, such as connecting a database and a web server, or if you want to transform data, such as performing calculations, you need to use a programming language. Examples: Python, JavaScript, Ruby

While markup languages like HTML provide an entry-point into coding, developers often remark that they do not truly experience the power of code until they master a programming language. And among programming languages included in TechRepublic's survey, Python ranks as the easiest to learn.

Python, designed with an emphasis on code readability, is well-known for being an intuitive programming language for everyone from high school students to NASA engineers. That means you too can experience the power of Python, and you've already come to the best place to learn.

Our Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_7_31_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) Pro Intensive makes learning Python easier than ever before. Complete nine weeks of exclusive curriculum, including five real-life projects, and you'll go from zero experience to a well-rounded coding foundation.

Don't wait to get going. The next session of Programming with Python ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_7_31_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=inline_link ) begins on July 31st.

Enroll Now ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/programming-with-python?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=pwp_7_31_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_link )

We're in The Economist; looking at errors in your code differently; coding is hard—keep going

Newsletter #53August 6, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Thinking About Errors in Your Code Differently ( https://news.codecademy.com/errors-in-code-think-differently/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly )

SyntaxError: Wow. You thought that would work? Are you sure this whole coding thing is for you?

Before even reading the text of an error message, it’s easy to feel discouraged. They’re usually red (scary!), they’re usually unexpected (frustrating!), and they never look like the output you were hoping to see.

But errors are a sign that you’re trying to build something great. And while the messages themselves can be demoralizing, learning to embrace them will make you a much better coder.

That’s why we wrote a step-by-step guide to reading, interpreting, and learning from every error message you encounter on your coding journey. As you’ll see, red is a beautiful color.

Read On ( https://news.codecademy.com/errors-in-code-think-differently/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly )

In Other News

( https://www.codecademy.com/courses/learn-python/lessons/python-syntax/exercises/print-statements?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly )

Start Chasing Errors
--------------------

If you’re ready to stop fearing error messages and start learning from them, consider taking the plunge into our free Python course ( https://www.codecademy.com/courses/learn-python/lessons/python-syntax/exercises/print-statements?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly ).

( https://www.economist.com/science-and-technology/2018/07/19/python-has-brought-computer-programming-to-a-vast-new-audience?utm_source=codecademynewsletter )

Why Python?
-----------

As The Economist noted, ( https://www.economist.com/science-and-technology/2018/07/19/python-has-brought-computer-programming-to-a-vast-new-audience?utm_source=codecademynewsletter ) recent Python users include "Pixar for
producing films, Google for crawling web pages and Spotify for recommending songs."

( https://news.codecademy.com/why-is-coding-so-hard-part-1/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly )

Coding is Hard—Keep Going
---------------------------

No matter which language you're learning, errors are one of many obstacles you'll encounter. Our goal is to make sure you never get down on
yourself ( https://news.codecademy.com/why-is-coding-so-hard-part-1/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8-1-18&utm_content=ErrorFortnightly ).

Take your data structures skills to the next level – learn how to build applications that scale efficiently and get a leg up in your next technical interview. First session starts September 4th. Limited seats available! Click to learn more.

---------------------------------------------
Computer Science with Python: Data Structures
---------------------------------------------

First session starts September 4th.Limited seats available!

Click to Learn More ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/computer-science-with-python-data-structures?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=cpd_9_04_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=top_cta )

Learn Data Structures ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/computer-science-with-python-data-structures?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=cpd_9_04_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=img )
Combine a Hash Map and a Trie data structure to identify top-rated New York restaurants.

In our newest Pro Intensive, Computer Science with Python: Data Structures, you’ll quickly gain the ability to write clean, efficient code that is able to scale. Codecademy's interactive learning environment makes data structures, a critical part of any programmer's repertoire, easier to learn than ever before.

Over the course of 7 weeks, you'll learn how to:

* Store complex data efficiently using Hash Maps and Trees.

* Read data quickly using stacks and queues.

* Confidently use Big-O notation to describe the time and space performance of commonly used data structures.

Take your Computer Science skills to the next level. In just a few weeks, you'll learn the theoretical data structures knowledge that self-taught programmers often lack – giving you an important edge up during your next technical interview. Don't panic next time you hear "Big O" in conversation. Completing this Intensive will put your mind at ease.

Click to Learn More ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/computer-science-with-python-data-structures?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=cpd_9_04_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_cta )

Hello Tusher Khan,

Due to a new agreement between WhatsApp and Google, WhatsApp backups will  
no longer count against Google Drive storage quota. However, any WhatsApp  
backups that have not been updated in more than a year will automatically  
be removed from storage.

This policy will go into effect for all users on November 12, 2018 though  
some users may see the quota benefits earlier. To avoid the loss of any  
backups, we recommend that people manually back up WhatsApp before November  
12, 2018.

Recommended Actions

1. Confirm that your current Android WhatsApp client is backed up  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/APDk4sOQN0vgXc7m0Kg5wHVecB0tnznPIKQizTbADuXdpEQA9hoE3L_PxVaqus7-lKPWLFvozH_G_uobYtcj_XdKpqLO5t1daJ3rmG6aPesUbysdmrjPhmHWVrC59xQydmpwa2hnB32YCcuy5OIuId427Q>

2. If you would like to refresh any existing backups, please manually back  
up your WhatsApp client before October 30, 2018

The Google Drive team

(c) 2018 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

This email was sent to tusherkhan573@gmail.com because you are a user of  
the Google Drive app and may be affected by this change.

New courses and content, learning in the classroom + Codecademy, and more!

Newsletter #54August 22, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Codecademy in the Classroom ( https://news.codecademy.com/codecademy-in-the-classroom/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8_22_18&utm_content=CCintheClassroom )

It’s that time of year again—back to school. Trade those freshly-sharpened pencils for supplies that will prepare you for the real future of work.

This fall, we’re releasing enough new content to stuff a locker, starting with our Computer Science Path ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/computer-science?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8_22_18&utm_content=CCintheClassroom ). It teaches CS fundamentals to anyone ready to learn—or teach!

As a team, we’ve been exploring how educators use Codecademy to supplement their classroom teaching. Read on to learn:

* Which school systems are most active on Codecademy
* Why and how extracurricular programs use Codecademy
* How teachers can incorporate Codecademy into their classrooms

Read On ( https://news.codecademy.com/codecademy-in-the-classroom/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_8_22_18&utm_content=CCintheClassroom )

Learn how to recreate the popular JavaScript library Lodash from scratch.

Our newest Pro Intensive, Intro to Programming in JavaScript, teaches you how to apply JavaScript fundamentals, such as Objects, Variables, Arrays, Loops, Conditionals, and more to real-life problems.

Over the course of 7 weeks, you'll learn how to:

* Troubleshoot any JavaScript error — preparing you to take on more challenging work down the road.

* Use JavaScript's control flow to conditionally execute commands.

* Showcase your skills by recreating an open source library!

Take your JavaScript skills to the next level. In just a few weeks, you'll be able to confidently write high-quality JavaScript code – giving you one of the most versatile skill sets in Web Development. Grammarly Business: Supercharge Your Work Team’s Communication
New Paths, new you; the history of JavaScript; Visual Studio vs. Sublime Text

Newsletter #55September 6, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Updates to Codecademy Paths ( https://news.codecademy.com/codecademy-paths-updates/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )

After helping 45 million people learn to code, we’ve learned a lot too.

One important lesson we’ve learned is that technical skills are not one-size-fits-all. What’s best for you is not always best for your friend; what’s best for a professional designer is not best for a college student.

With that in mind, we completely reinvented Paths. Now, no matter what destination you have in mind, we’ll make sure you have the right tools to get there:

* Web Development ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/web-development?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )—master the languages of the web
* Data Science ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/data-science?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )—use Python and SQL to query, analyze, and visualize data
* Computer Science ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/computer-science?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )—learn the theory behind programming
* Code Foundations ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/paths/code-foundations?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )—go here if you’re not sure where to start

Read on to learn how to access these new Paths, and then get back to coding.

Updates to Codecademy Paths ( https://news.codecademy.com/codecademy-paths-updates/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )

In Other News

( https://news.codecademy.com/javascript-history-popularity/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )

A Brief History of JavaScript
-----------------------------

Fun fact: JavaScript is the most popular language among developers. Another fun fact: it all started with a browser war between Microsoft and Netscape ( https://news.codecademy.com/javascript-history-popularity/?utm_source=customer.io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/visual-studio-code-sublime-text/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )

Visual Studio vs. Sublime Text
------------------------------

One of the most common questions we get is, “Where should I write code when I’m not on Codecademy?” We compared two of the
most popular options ( https://news.codecademy.com/visual-studio-code-sublime-text/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths ).

( https://news.codecademy.com/why-data-structures/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths )

Why Data Structures?
--------------------

Data structures are a cornerstone of every computer science curriculum. We explained
what they are, why they’re useful, and how you can use them effectively ( https://news.codecademy.com/why-data-structures/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_6_18&utm_content=NewPaths ).

Meet our new Paths
If you can’t see this email - View it in your browser. ( http://track.customer.io/deliveries/ZM-kAgABZcO5l7xlIJPdOeGZixh0 )

 

 

New Courses from Codecademy ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/introduction-to-blockchain?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=header_img )

 

 

Hey!

 

We hope you enjoyed your summer. It’s now officially fall, or as we like to say, the season of “getting back at it.”

 

Back to school, back to work, back to that side project. . . whatever it is that you’re getting back to, we’re here to help you make it happen.

 

While you were busy soaking up the last days of summer, we’ve been hard at work creating 12 brand new courses to keep you busy all through fall (and possibly winter!).

 

Starting today we’re opening two new free courses. See them below:

 

 

 

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/introduction-to-blockchain?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=img )

Intro to Blockchain

 

Want to be able to talk intelligently about Blockchain and apply the fundamentals to your work? After this course you’ll be able to do that and more, including build a blockchain library in Python and create your own blocks through interactive simulations.

Explore Blockchain ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/introduction-to-blockchain?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=inline_link )

 

 

 

 

( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-color-design?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=img )

Learn Color Design

 

You know CSS, but do you know how to use colors effectively? Deepen your knowledge of color design and learn how to use colors more effectively to influence landing page conversion and improve the design quality of your apps.

Explore Color Design ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/learn-color-design?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=inline_link )

 

 

 

 

But wait, there’s more. . .

 

In addition to the free courses, we'll also be launching 10 premium courses that you can access if you upgrade to Codecademy Pro. During the month of September, we’ll be dropping fresh Pro courses every Monday. So check your inbox each week for the latest courses!

 

log in ( https://www.codecademy.com/learn/introduction-to-blockchain?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=course_announcement_09_18_free&utm_medium=email&utm_content=bottom_cta )

 

Want a sneak peek at the courses? Follow us on Twitter ( https://twitter.com/codecademy ), Facebook ( https://facebook.com/codecademy ), and Instagram ( https://instagram.com/codecademy ).

 

 

 

 

Wait, what’s Pro again? ?

 

Pro is our premium product that lets you go deeper in your coding journey and apply your skills in real-life. Get access to exclusive courses, extra practice quizzes, and real-world projects.

12 New Courses for Getting Back to It ???
-----------------------------
Machine Learning Fundamentals
-----------------------------

First session starts September 18th.Limited seats available!

Click to Learn More ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/machine-learning-fundamentals?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=mlf_9_18_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=top_cta )

Learn Data Structures ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/machine-learning-fundamentals?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=mlf_9_18_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=img )
Predict a restaurant's rating by implementing supervised learning algorithms that use real-life Yelp reviews.

In our newest Pro Intensive, Machine Learning Fundamentals, you’ll quickly gain the ability to capitalize on one of the most important computing trends over the last five years: Artificial Intelligence.

Over the course of 7 weeks, you'll learn how to:

* Build a linear regression model – one of the most widely used techniques to predict the relationship between variables.

* Build a Naive Bayes classifier that automatically detects different sentiments in text messages and customer reviews on Amazon.

* Implement a building block of a neural network – an advanced Machine Learning technique that mimics how a human brain interprets new data.

* And so much more!

Take your Machine Learning skills to the next level. In just a few weeks, you'll go from zero experience to being able to build computer systems that can access and use data to make intelligent predictions. Don't wait to secure your spot in our first session! It begins September 18th.

Click to Learn More ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/machine-learning-fundamentals?utm_source=customer_io&utm_campaign=mlf_9_18_18&utm_medium=email&utm_term=a&utm_content=bottom_cta )

import face_detector
Hi,

In today's blog post, you will learn how to apply OpenCV OCR
(Optical Character Recognition) ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY2MTg3MjIxMyIsInVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnB5aW1hZ2VzZWFyY2guY29tLzIwMTgvMDkvMTcvb3BlbmN2LW9jci1hbmQtdGV4dC1yZWNvZ25pdGlvbi13aXRoLXRlc3NlcmFjdC8_X19zPWloeW5uNnFibWZ5NjFhcXR6Z3ByIn0 ).

We will perform both (1) text detection and (2)
text recognition using OpenCV, Python, and Tesseract + deep
learning:

Image ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY2MTg3MjIxMyIsInVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnB5aW1hZ2VzZWFyY2guY29tLzIwMTgvMDkvMTcvb3BlbmN2LW9jci1hbmQtdGV4dC1yZWNvZ25pdGlvbi13aXRoLXRlc3NlcmFjdC8_X19zPWloeW5uNnFibWZ5NjFhcXR6Z3ByIn0 )

You may recall that a few weeks ago I showed you how to perform
text detection using OpenCV’s EAST deep learning model. Using
this model we were able to detect and localize the bounding box
coordinates of text contained in an image.

The next step is to take each of these areas containing text and
actually recognize and OCR the text using OpenCV and Tesseract.

To learn how to build your own OpenCV OCR and text recognition
pipeline, be sure to read the full tutorial here! ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY2MTg3MjIxMyIsInVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnB5aW1hZ2VzZWFyY2guY29tLzIwMTgvMDkvMTcvb3BlbmN2LW9jci1hbmQtdGV4dC1yZWNvZ25pdGlvbi13aXRoLXRlc3NlcmFjdC8_X19zPWloeW5uNnFibWZ5NjFhcXR6Z3ByIn0 )

Cheers,

Adrian Rosebrock

OpenCV OCR and text recognition [with Python code]
Yesterday around lunch time, right as I was finishing up my kale,
carrot, and avocado salad, I received an email from Jonathan, a
PyImageSearch reader. Jonathan wanted to know if I could share
the table of contents for my books, Practical Python and OpenCV +
Case Studies ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY2ODkzMzI1OSIsInVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnB5aW1hZ2VzZWFyY2guY29tL3ByYWN0aWNhbC1weXRob24tb3BlbmN2Lz9lbWFpbD10dXNoZXJraGFuNTczQGdtYWlsLmNvbVx1MDAyNl9fcz1paHlubjZxYm1meTYxYXF0emdwciJ9 ).

I replied back to Jonathan saying "Of course I can!" I included
the list of chapters inside my books in my reply to him, but
thought I would share them with you as well -- just in case you
are interested.

The table of contents for Practical Python and OpenCV is pretty
long, so I've just included just the table of contents for Case
Studies:

1. Introduction
2. Face Detection
3. Webcam Face Detection
4. Object Tracking in Video
5. Eye Tracking
6. Handwriting Recognition with HOG
7. Plant Classification
8. Building an Amazon.com Cover Search
9. Conclusions

If any of these topics sound interesting to you (or if you want
the table of contents for Practical Python and OpenCV as well), I
would definitely suggest grabbing the full sample chapter for my
books by clicking this link ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY2ODkzMzI1OSIsInVybCI6Imh0dHA6Ly9kcmlwLmxhL2MvZXlKaFkyTnZkVzUwWDJsa0lqb2lORGMyT0RReU9TSXNJblJ5YVdkblpYSmZhV1FpT2lJME9UZzBNelF5SWl3aWRYSnNJam9pYUhSMGNEb3ZMM2QzZHk1d2VXbHRZV2RsYzJWaGNtTm9MbU52YlM5a2IyNWxMWE5oYlhCc1pTMWphR0Z3ZEdWeUx5Sjk_X19zPWloeW5uNnFibWZ5NjFhcXR6Z3ByIn0 ).

Once you click the link above, I'll personally email you the
sample chapter in just a few short seconds.

Cheers,

Adrian Rosebrock

Hi,

Raise your hand if you've ever had trouble compiling and
installing OpenCV from source before? ???

What if you could instead just do a simple pip install opencv? ( http://t.dripemail2.com/c/eyJhY2NvdW50X2lkIjoiNDc2ODQyOSIsImRlbGl2ZXJ5X2lkIjoiMzY4NzE4NzI1MCIsInVybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnB5aW1hZ2VzZWFyY2guY29tLzIwMTgvMDkvMTkvcGlwLWluc3RhbGwtb3BlbmN2Lz9fX3M9aWh5bm42cWJtZnk2MWFxdHpncHIifQ )

Use Machine Learning to break down T-Swift — all you’re ever gonna need’s k-means. Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Newsletter #56September 20, 2018

Essential news, trends, and stories from Codecademy and the world of code.

Using Machine Learning to Analyze Taylor Swift's Lyrics ( https://news.codecademy.com/taylor-swift-lyrics-machine-learning/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_20_18&utm_content=TSwift )

As the title of her fifth studio album suggests, Taylor Swift was born in 1989. In the years since, she’s had one of the most successful music careers ever, winning every trophy, plaque, and Moonman there is to win.

Another post-1989 (and post-1989) development: Machine Learning has entered the mainstream. That’s why we released a new Pro Intensive that will give you hands-on experience with it.

To celebrate Machine Learning Fundamentals ( https://www.codecademy.com/pro/intensive/machine-learning-fundamentals?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_20_18&utm_content=TSwift ), we used ML to answer some of the most pressing questions about T-Swift’s storied career, such
as:

* When was she writing lyrics most focused on growing up?
* Which of her albums have the biggest emphasis on heartbreak?
* Did Beyoncé really have one of the best videos of all time?

Ok, maybe not that last one, but there’s only one way to know for sure.

Using Machine Learning to Analyze Taylor Swift's Lyrics ( https://news.codecademy.com/taylor-swift-lyrics-machine-learning/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_20_18&utm_content=TSwift )

In Other News

( https://news.codecademy.com/survivor-storylines-machine-learning/?utm_source=customer_io&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fortnightly_9_20_18&utm_content=TSwift )
